73306830.review:
Nach nunmehr über 300 Stunden will ich auch mal meine Meinung zu Civ VI abgeben. diese ist sehr differenziert und daher ist meine endgültige Empfehlung (ja/nein) auch sehr schwierig, aber dennoch überlegt. Dazu später mehr.

Zuerst einmal halte ich Civ für ein Spiel mit dem man über sehr lange Zeit sehr viel Spaß haben kann. Meine Spielzeiten streue ich auf sehr viele Spiele und bei über 300 Stunden für ein Spiel ist das bei mir schon eine Aussage. Daher kann man nicht sagen, Civ macht keinen Spaß. Magst du Rundenstrategie und hast bock auf ein paar coole Stunden, dann hör hier auf zu lesen, dann ist Civ die richtige Wahl. Am Anfang herausfordernd, aber im späteren Verlauf auch nicht zu komplex.Und dank vieler Sales auch einigermaßen erschwinglich.

Nun aber zu den (negativen) Aspekten, die zu meinem Ergebnis geführt haben:

[u]1. Preis/Leistung - Entwicklung des Spiels[/u]
Civ ist an seinem heutigen Tag ein sehr umfangreiches Spiel, dank vieler Sales auch einigermaßen erschwinglich. Aber die DLC-Politik ist schon sehr auffällig. Vor allem, wenn man dieses Spiel in den Kontext seiner Vorgänger stellt. Das Hauptspiel wirkt verglichen mit den Vorgängern als (gewollter) Rückschritt, Ich kaufe kein fertiges Spiel, welches um coole Features in den DLCs erweitert wird, sondern habe stehts das Gefühl, dass ich erst mit dem 3. DLC (wie auch schon beim Vorgänger) ein komplettes Spiel besitze. Dazu kommen inzwischen unzählige Erweiterungspacks für Zivilisationen und Anführer. Letzteres kann ich noch eher verstehen als ersteres. Wobei es schon stört, dass dann auch jeder in einem Multiplayerspiel diesen Zivilisations-DLC benötigt, damit ich ihn spielen kann. Das könnte man auch durch optionales verbieten in den Einstellungen ändern. 
Aber zurück zu den Haupt-DLCs: als Fan der Reihe investiert man dann schon seine 120 Euro für das Vollständige Spiel (ohne die gerade erschienenen neuen Zivilisationen). Und wenn ich ehrlich bin? Das alleine ist sogar okay für mich, wenn das Spiel für mich einen entsprechenden Langzeitfaktor hat. Und der ist zu jetzigem Stand leider restlos verbraucht.
Dazu will ich am Rand anmerken, dass dem Spiel bei Release auch in der Benutzeroberfläche genretypische Optionen und Ansichten fehlten, die bei den Vorgängern längst vorhanden waren. Dies ist nicht ausschlaggebend für meine Wertung, schließlich wurden die nachgeliefert. Aber es zeigt den unfertigen Zustand des Spiels bei Release, welches diese DLC/Preis-Politik nur unterstreicht.

[u]2. Die KI[/u]
Okay, hierauf will ich gar nicht zu intensiv eingehen. Das wird in Zahlreichen Zeitschriften und auch hier in den Kommentaren schon häufig genug erwähnt und beschrieben. Aber es sollte zumindest kurz mit drin sein:
Die KI ist in jedem Schwierigkeitsgrad unfassbar dumm, planlos und agiert wie die Axt im Walde. Seit diesem Teil wurden der KI gewissen Eigenschaften verliehen, die unterschiedlich agieren lassen sollen. Das heißt die Expansionspolitik oder die Kulturpolitik sind von KI zu KI etwas unterschiedlich. Dennoch ist ein Spiel gegen die KI immer nur ein Wettlauf. Je höher der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist, desto höher sind die Boni, die die KI bekommt. Sprich: Es wird einfach nur immer unfairer. So muss man auf einem hohen Schwierigkeitsgrad darauf gefasst sein, sich gegen eine Übermacht zu verteidigen. Je weiter man im Spiel ist, desto einfacher ist dann aber doch der Sieg, weil man mit fortlaufenden Spiel immer bessere Einblicke erhält, dass es bei der KI immer nur um die Materialschlacht geht, nie um wirkliche Strategie.

[u]2.1 Das Diplomatiesystem mit KI[/u]
Hier will ich zumindest mal erwähnt haben, wie nervig die völlig sinnbefreiten Anfragen der KI sind, die schon an Spam anmuten. Und der Weltkongress ist mit KI auch meistens nur ein Witz, weil die KI, selbst wenn man Sie in ein Team steckt, nie wirklich nach Plan agiert.

[u]3. Das Ressourcen-Problem[/u]
"Lasst uns ein Spiel Civ starten, ich habe aber nur noch 2 Stunden Zeit, aber lasst uns zumindest mal eine Karte finden, die Spielbar ist."
Dieser Satz beschreibt den Beginn eines typischen Multiplayer-Spiels von Civ VI. Das größte Problem ist stehts ein Spiel zu finden, wenn man zu dritt oder gar zu viert spielt, in dem jeder einen halbwegs spielbaren und vergleichbaren Startplatz hat. Das führte dann schon soweit, dass auch schon das ein oder andere Mal ein Spieler sagte "Der Platz nicht scheiße, aber nicht unspielbar, ich will jetzt anfangen, also ist's okay." Das führte dann regelmäßig zu Neustarts, welche aber gar nicht so einfach möglich sind. Man kann kein Spiel einfach neu starten. Man muss es beenden und komplett neu hosten. Eine später hinzugefügte Speicheroption des eingerichteten Spiels führt leider dazu, dass der Kartenseed immer der gespeicherte bleibt. Also gilt es jedes mal die gesamten Einstellungen neu zu machen.
Das ist aber nicht mal das Ärgerlichste an dem "Verteilungsproblem". Das Ärgerlichste ist, dass man die meisten strategischen Ressourcen erst im späteren Spielverlauf zu sehen bekommt. Das hat zur Folge, dass man manchmal erst nach 5 Stunden im laufenden Spiel merkt, dass seine eigene Position schlecht ist und man komplett von der Gnade der Mitspieler abhängig ist, wenn man im späteren Spielverlauf Kriegsmaschinerie bauen möchte. Es gab schon spiele, da hatte ich nicht eine der späteren Ressourcen in meinem 7 Städte umfassenden Gebiet. Ohne Verbündete hätte ich dann auch einfach einpacken können.

[u]4. Das Late-Game[/u]
Dass ein Early-Game sich oft "gleich" anfühlt (und das tut es bei Civ VI), ist bei einem Stratgiespiel in meinen Augen nicht tragisch. Und an dieser Stelle möchte ich auch eine Lanze brechen für das Mid-Game. Das Midgame ist in der Regel spannend, fühlt sich dank unterschiedlicher Spielmöglichkeiten divers an und macht in einem normalen Multiplayer-Gefecht mit KI auch den Hauptteil des Spiel aus, da das Spiel dank schwacher KI manchmal etwas zu schnell vorbei ist.
Dennoch enttäuscht mich am meisten das Lategame. Die hier zu erreichenden Forschungsmöglichkeiten und kulturellen Entwicklungen sind fad und steuern allenfalls auf eine "Zielgerade" hin, Militärisch bekommt man Superwaffen (Roboter und Atomwaffen) an die Hand, Ansonsten schaltet man nur noch die Komponenten für einen Wissenschaftssieg frei. Hier will einen das Spiel nur noch zum Ende führen. Das hat zur Folge dass sich das Endgame auch fast imemr irgendwie gleich anfühlt. Zudem sind die Möglichkeiten ein spiel zu gewinnen oft enttäuschend unspektakulär. Während ein Religionssieg einfach nur anstrengende Arbeit ist, kann man von einem Kultursieg auf einmal völlig überrascht werden, wenn man die Statistiken nicht dauernd im Auge behält. Vor allem sind ab einem gewissen Stadium eigentlich nur noch militärische Mittel möglich um einen Sieg eines anderen Spielers zu verhindern. So ist es oft schon zu Beginn eines spiels die Frage, ob man nicht gleich auf Herrschaftssieg spielen sollte.

[u][b]Fazit:[/b][/u]
Wie schon einleitend geschrieben, hab ich bei Civ VI über viele Stunden sehr viel Spaß gehabt. Wer sich sagt "300 Spielstunden Spaß sind doch eine super Sache", dem kann ich von dem Spiel nicht wirklich abraten. 

Dennoch gebe ich diesem Spiel eine negative Bewertung. Warum? Weil vor allem, die oben genannten Punkte dazu geführt haben, dass ich das Spiel inzwischen weggelegt habe und sich meine Motivation es nochmal zu spielen in Grenzen hält.

Was mich am meisten betrübt, ist die Tatsache, dass das Spiel soweit hinter seinen Möglichkeiten bleibt. 
Ein Spiel mit so vielen, teils handwerklichen Fehlern, die so offensichtlich für Frust sorgen, wie zum Beispiel die Ressourcen-Verteilung, kann von mir leider keine positive Bewertung bekommen.

Bewertung für Kurzzeitspieler: 7/10
Bewertung für Langzeitspieler: 4/10

Ótimo jogo, para quem tem tempo livre, e gosta de história e estratégia, é um prato cheio... porém, como dito anteriormente em outras análises, caso você tenha somente a versão base do jogo, a experiência fica incompleta.  Para uma experiência mais completa, a expansão Gathering The Storm é imprescindível.

Recomendo comprar nesta ordem; Jogo base -> Gathering Storm -> Rise and fall. Recentemente saiu o pack da Ethiopia e o dos mayas e gran colombia, que adicionam novos recursos estratégicos/luxos, catástrofes e sociedade secreta.

Único contra que vale a pena ressaltar é o preço, para um experiência completa e divertida  é preciso de pelo menos ( minha opinião ) Gathering Storm e Rise and Fall que se somar com o jogo base o valor fica R$ 278,98 na atual data de ( 27/07/2020) o que é bem salgado para o bolso.

While I appreciate the free weekend, I put 20 hours into this game and overall my experience wasn't bad, but rather just...confusing.

I remember when it was released everyone said the AI was bad, and it certainly is. I've had a leader yell at me for building my cities too close when said leader is on the opposite side of the continent. I randomly had a joint war declared on me from 2 leaders that were both pleased with me. Something like +16 relation. Likewise, they were both on the opposite side of the continent so we barely even interacted, no border friction or anything.
The reasons leaders like and dislike you are downright cartoonish and it's hard to make sense of anything they really do. I understand it from a game mechanic standpoint to a certain extent, but it's just so hard to stay immersed.

73712635.review: This is the 5th civ game I've ever played with and probably the finest so far if you have the Rise and Fall and The Gathering Storm DLCs in your library, I think it is almost as good as the Civ 5 which is considered the best so far by most of the fans. I like the feature of global warming but diplomacy and trading with commodities should be more realistic (I mean you can gather diplomatic victory points but if you lack the true capabilities to defend yourself and your allies you should not be able the achieve diplomatic victory but of course this is only my point of view). I think electricity should be also a commodity like in real life where some countries can produce more and export it not to mention oil what is actually a resource in the game but if you think of our world for example the importance of the global shipping lines...so this could add some spicey more strategic flavour to the game in my view. The combat system should be upgraded as well I think more like thinking in divisions like in the old Panzer Generals or Panzer Corps today. Fighter squadrons and your air defence systems should also be able to cover larger territories not just a small part around your cities. But these are mostly recommendations to an already good game (respect to the developers). So I think if you haven't tried this game you should because this is still a unique one in its genre.

Не могу описать игру иначе, как:
> вспоминаешь о шестой циве
> "хм, интересно, почему я её забросил?"
> "ах, вот почему"
> забываешь о шестой циве до следующего апдейта

Я не могу даже выделить конкретных причин. Вроде, графика стала лучше, с дополнениями появляются такие вещи, как природные катаклизмы. С другой стороны, мне уже надоели эти везде снующие миссионеры, эти постоянные войны из-за ничего от ИИ. Иногда ИИ резко переходят из друзей во врагов без причины, и невозможно предсказать, как и когда. Возможно, конечно, это я плохо играю, но я не могу поднять сложность выше второй по счёту.

Я продолжаю играть в пятую циву, потому что эта игра подстраивается под мой стиль. Ну не хочу я слишком напрягаться и ставлю низкую сложность, чтобы отдохнуть. В шестой циве игра плюнет вам в лицо в 40% случаев, заставив штамповать армию и повсеместно бояться проиграть.

Ждал, что моё мнение изменится, с самого релиза, но так и не дождался. Не рекомендую. Оценка: не выше 4/10.

73571491.review: I must start off by saying that this is my first experience with the Civilization franchise and Civilization VI absolutely blew my wig off, well I don't wear wigs but if I did, it certainly would be half way down the street by now. This game is phenomenal, as someone who is crazy into history, this was certainly right up my alley and it doubles as a fantastic, high quality, unforgettable experience, I will truly never forget the experience I had with Civilization VI. At first, I was on the fence about getting it because I wasn't sure what I was getting into simply due to the fact that I'd never played or really even watched anything got to do with this series but I, without a doubt, do not regret picking up this game. Had I been playing on PC when this was released, I would've pick this up without a second thought had I known the sheer enjoyment this game could've given me. I cannot recommend this game enough to anyone interested in history, civilization micromanagement, and turn based strategy games. Now I have to add that the games can be quick or slow, it is entirely up to you, but regardless of what you decide on, the games will ultimately still be relatively long but that is just the type of game this is so if you're not finished in a reasonable amount of time or you just simply don't have long to play, you can always save and come back later, right where you left off. Civilization VI does also contain mulitplayer which can either work asynchronous or synchronous, you decide before you begin. I personally never got into any online games myself but I imagine it could certainly be some fun. If you have the opportunity to play Civilization VI, please do it, not for me, but for yourself, it is an experience unlike any other. Thank you.

73478445.review:
I was on the fence for a while posting a negative review as there is so much to like about this game, however on reflection, its hard to recommend it when Civ V feels like arguably the better choice.

A few caveats first - I'm a Civi veteran, however I don't get a ton of time to play, so this review is tailored for folks like me who maybe have time to devote to a single playthrough before moving on to something else. If you have plenty of time to devote to Civilization and will have longer to learn some of the tricks, you'll likely get more out of it than I did.

A few key negatives:

 - The religious victory condition - this I feel is my primary downer, naturally you can turn it off but as per my previous point, if you're only playing through a game once, you kind of want to experience everything which means playing with everything enabled. The downside is huge though - essentially if you don't found a religion, you're pretty boned as other players can spread religion and you have zero tools to prevent it. By the end of the game I was actively trying to determine how to destory my cities, as I didn't appreciate how close I was to giving someone else a Religious victory, which leads me on to...

- Poor UX around providing critical information - for a game built entirely on information, it does a poor job of surfacing this to the player at key moments. You're running negative gold? Zero UI changes to show that you're about to go bankrupt, just colouring it red would draw attention to it, or a Stellaris esque "you have 3 more turns before you go bankrupt". There is a lot going on - any cues which help the player focus on whats important help! If someone is going to win a Religious victory... maybe tell me "before" it happens? 

The information is of course all available if you dig for it, but for a game that sends you an absurd number of superfluous notifications (cool, they're building a Bank in the next city over!), it misses the mark on the critical stuff, which is frustrating as in my game I ended up completely unable to win unless I rolled back to an auto-save like 50 turns ago and started butchering missionaries.

- Finally, diplomacy as a whole was completely inoperable in my game which was very frustrating. This was partially my own fault - I invaded another country early on due to being hemmed in, but then my warmonger rating among the other players skyrocketed and never seemed to come down. After about 40 turns post-conquering the player, and with a still sky high rating preventing my indulging in any diplomacy, I ended up just invading everyone, which didn't feel great. In addition - given my absolute dominance, why did no-one at least attempt to cozy up and make an alliance, instead of just denouncing constantly and doing nothing about it.

Overall, this is absolutely not a bad game, I had a lot of fun parts in my 22 hours, but I was left with a sour taste after the issues outlined above. The tl;dr is - while playing through again I'd be aware of these issues, the game I feel could do so much more to educate/inform the player at key moments, and by failing to do so spoiled things with some mechanics I wasn't able to interact with.

73541415.review:
tl;dr only buy this game, rise and fall & gathering storm WHILE ON SALE: AT LEAST 40% (steam summer sale recently had a 70% sale on the base game, which is an absolute steal even if it is pretty meh) 
Buy character DLCs or others under own discretion. 

The actual game itself serves as a decent introduction to the game. You'll easily spend a lot of time here (in my case, 100+ hours) but I'd imagine that the game becomes stale if you're approaching 1000 hours just on the base game alone. This is a very addicting game otherwise and as time goes on, the game has been improving from its pretty shocking release state. With that being said, the art style and the actual gameplay I feel was designed to capture a wider catchment of consumers - it's pretty noob-friendly and the art-style is a lot more cartoonish than past games. I'll leave this up to you but I personally enjoy it over the realistic Civ 5 style.  

Perhaps the biggest critcism I have about this game is the AI. It was terrible initially, but it is still mostly terrible to this day. AI would seemingly declare surprise wars for almost no reason. Even in higher levels of difficulty (i.e. Deity) they still declare such wars, but this time they usually can win since they spawn with more troops :))) 
This leads onto the main point - the AI doesn't get smarter as you ramp up difficulty, the AI simply has more advantages given to them compared to you :)))))))))))

Rise and Fall is basically a must-have, as it adds a lot of new features and Civs for a relatively low price (again, buy on sale). Whilst some features really should have been in the base game (diplomatic victory, historic moments) we don't have much of a choice here so if you had to buy ONE DLC, please get this one! 

Gathering Storm (GS) is perhaps my favourite DLC right now, adding climate change and plentiful features in the game. I however wouldn't purchase this DLC for full price - please just buy it on sale! This pack features some of my favourite Civs (Mali, France alternative) and the governer system makes the game very interesting. 

These two DLCs should let you play with most online lobbies! Have fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Don't make the mistake of thinking this application is any kind of a wargame. The entire humanist manifesto seems to have been embedded into this vision of what a perfect world could be "If only everyone listened to me". Excellent graphics, Great narrations by a very talented and prolific actor. plenty of growth to be made over the tech & culture trees, but here's the thing: it all feels like Alice in Wonderland. This is the Matrix that everyone woke up from and died. It simply has so very little real life to it that  all the time you play you hear your own psyche screaming from the recesses of your mind, "This aint real, wake up!" 

Recommend if on sale for like 15 bucks
Not Recommended if you demand a realistic scenario and / or want realistic warfare side effects.

73645353.review:
【楽しめると思う人】
・広大なマップ上に大量のユニットが動き回るのが好きな人
・複雑なルール、色々なパラメータを扱うゲームが好きな人

【世界観について】
技術、学問など人類がたどった流れを一応たどるけど、ややいびつに感じがする。
きっちり歴史通りに描けるわけがないと分かっているし、ゲームのために簡略化は当然に必要だが、それを差し引いても何かちぐはぐさを受けてしまった。こだわっているのだろうと勝手に期待を抱いたせいかもしれない。

名称（地名や人物名）・地理については歴史を利用したファンタジーと言って差し支えない。実在の国に関連した都市名が登場するが位置関係もバラバラ。

自分がやったときは、日本とアメリカとフランスが一つの大陸に同居していた。我がアラビア国は首都カイロに紫禁城を建築し、同盟関係にある日本は京都にオックスフォード大学を設立。キリスト教国であるアメリカを日本の仏教とアラビアのイスラム教で改宗を進める、という非常にカオスな世界になった。
歴史的なキーワードはたくさん登場するが、世界史通りにたどることはないと思うので、そういうのが嫌な人は評価が下がるかもしれない。やり直したら全く違う展開になると思うので、遊ぶたびに新しい世界と歴史が作れると思う人がハマっていくのかもしれない。

全方位敵対外交でも、なるべく他の国と仲良くなっていこうとするも自由。科学の国にする？文化芸術の国にする？世界宗教を作る？という自由度の高さは魅力的だと思う。

※フリープレイでの感想です

73292463.review:
Civ VI is the "lost iteration". It's relatively worthless. 

Civ IV and Civ V represent the current peak of the franchise. Civ IV has the best soundtrack, and the best mods. The mod, "fall from heaven II", is arguably the best game of all time. The mod, "legends of revolution" is the best "regular" civ game of all time. 

Civ V represents an amazing evolution of the basic engine, especially considering the move to a hex grid, and only having one unit per tile. This makes tactics more realistic. And Civ V has the best graphics.

Civ VI, by comparison, is a steaming pile of dog excrement with flies circling over it. The graphics are terrible. The map is boring. The human characters look stupid and cartoonish. In Civ V, all the human characters have dignity, and the hint that they are strong, and would not hesitate to crush you if you got in your way. They are presented as worthy adversaries. But in Civ VI, it's impossible to take them seriously... there's no artistic integrity.

And the soundtrack of Civ VI is appalling. I played the game for 143 hours, and I can't remember any music from it except the 4000 bc song that sounds like banjo music from "deliverance". Civ IV and Civ V, by contrast, have musical selections that remain personal favorites of mine to this day. 

Lastly, Civ VI is totally unbalanced. It's impossible to select a difficulty level that provides a consistently pleasant gaming experience. It's either so easy it's mind-numbingly boring, or it's hopeless to attempt at all.

In a nutshell, I have forsworn playing Civ VI at all. I've recently reloaded Civ V, and may soon reload Civ IV.

It is my earnest hope that the abomination of Civ VI will be buried like a nugget of cat dung, and Civ VII will emerge, phoenix-like, from the flaming excrement pile, and set a new, higher standard of excellence for the franchise.

How to do this: go OLD SCHOOL. Get brains like Brian Reynolds, Soren Johnson, the kid who did Civ V, sit them down, and say, "Make us the best game possible, given the limitations of present technology. Give us the most soul-stirring soundtrack, the most awe-inspiring and sublime graphics, the most satisfying challenges, and the most mind-blowing mods (perhaps get Derek Paxton to help do a new "fall from heaven")"

73933915.review:
非常明显的西方，更准确来说是美国意识形态下的娱乐产物。理由如下
1.最明显也是最可笑的就是一个区区240几年历史的国家被严重夸大历史影响（美国游戏 主观上理解，客观上可笑）
2.有着非常强烈对战争的欲望，最好的证明就是除建造者开拓者商人外几乎所有的单位都是直接或间接服务于战争，以及被重视的掠夺。假如说战争贯穿一局，那么掠夺就几乎贯穿每场战争，甚至有不少市政支持掠夺。这也照应了西方的崛起，美国发战争财的快速崛起，而很少能整局和平发展。
3.东西方文化差异，和中国儒家强调的以德服人相反，典型西方的畏武而不怀德。
4.大量的间谍行动传达非常强烈的和平演变的信号，游戏内外都崇尚于干涉他国内政。
5.极致到骨子里的双标，体现在对开城，间谍监视，宗教皈依等问题的承诺时npc的表态。
综上，作为游戏我乐意给好评，无论是迪士尼画风的人物，还是各种机制设计和对历史一定的还原都不错，但作为美国输出文化霸权的帮手之一，我也只能说，就这？

63946086.review:
"都凌晨一点半了，快点睡！"

母亲的声音从客厅悠悠传来，我轻咳一声，敲下windows键呼出电脑任务栏看了一眼右下角的时间

 1:20

不知不觉又这么晚了，我心里暗叹。

我回头望向卧室门口，开口道：“知道了，马上睡，不过才1点20，还没到一点半呢”

没有回应，只传来了越来越模糊的脚步声。我转过头来，重新看向电脑屏幕。

屏幕上来自罗马的军队已经大军压境，前线的部队寥寥无几，现在正可谓我国的危难存亡之际。

作为国家的领导人，我不能临阵脱逃，我咬咬牙，待我击败敌军凯旋归来就娶你回——呸呸呸

待我击败罗马的进犯之敌就马上睡觉，我对这个想法十分满意的点了点头，然后我的目光不自觉地飘向游戏屏幕的右下角。

那几个赫然的大字

[下一回合]


















.  .  .     .  .  .



























我国的军队在强盛经济实力的支撑下越发强盛，敌人正在逐渐败退，我国的军队乘胜追击，一路收复失地，大败敌军，对罗马的自卫战争逐渐变为了自卫反击战。

最后在势不可挡的军事实力之下，我国的将士们攻破了敌人的首都。

我洋洋得意，呼出电脑任务栏，右下角数字显示为 1:08

“嗯，才12分钟解决战斗了，不愧是我”我压下疯狂上扬的嘴角，将游戏保存并关闭，丝毫没注意到右上角的8个红色的小脸蛋。

远处传来几声的狗吠，我望向窗外，总感觉12分钟前的月亮和现在月亮似乎有什么不同，我并没有太过在意。

熄灯，睡觉。

Good Night，and Life Well.

51271106.review:
（写于19年6月更新之后）

在5代和6代都快到达2000小时的游戏时间后，我想我可以较为确定的来推荐这款游戏了
之前很多玩5代时认识的朋友会问我6代是否值得入手，犹豫的原因可能是被6代的差评率给吓到了
就差评率的问题，我相信主要是来自坑爹的豪华版预售和之前的Redshell事件，而非游戏质量

和5代一样，在经历了两个大型DLC之后，6代也从几乎全面被前作碾压，变得相对完善，且诸多方面较5代更进一步了
下面，就游戏的各方面，我给两个版本打个主观的分数，方便大家参考


[b]游戏性（发展）[/b]

Civ 6 ★★★★★
Civ 5 ★★★★

建设发展作为文明系列的核心玩法，在5代已经做得非常优秀了
不过，5代在发展模式的选择上还是略微单一，联机模式的传统树过强，单机模式又有一些取巧的诸如切术爆铺的手法
相较5代，6代将扩张的惩罚从科技文化阈值的增加改到了新城市的区域产能惩罚
直观的说，爆铺虽然会导致新城建设变慢，但对国家整体产出看上去有益无害了

虽然这导致了单机模式下爆铺似乎变成过于强力的选择
但相较于5代铺下去就很难攻破的城市，6代的新建城市变得异常脆弱，需要区域、城墙甚至军营以及远近搭配的兵种才能做到易守难攻
过度的扩张会消耗金钱、宗教点数、总督点数和政策卡槽等公共资源，并使得防守成型的节奏变慢
再加上骑兵的增强和忠诚度的存在，联机模式下的玩家必须慎重的决定扩张的进度，审时度势地决定前期的策略
而且，前期对应精铺、爆铺、战狂打法的三种市政建筑，让三种打法都有自身的优势，这是我非常欣赏6代的一点
另外，19年6月更新后，前期蛮族的数量和攻击欲望极大增强，甚至会带攻城器械，玩家前期需要相当的兵力去防守蛮族，这对于玩家前期爆铺的风险也提高了更多

此外，6代一定程度上强化了文化线和宗教内容，这也让玩家在发展的过程中可以略微倾斜向科技之外的选项
诸如中世纪黄金时代，通过港口和商业中心转化科技的选项，让前期的发展模式变得更为丰富多彩，使玩家间的国力赛跑变得更有对抗性
这些多样性也让游戏的平衡性自然而然的较之5代进步了一些

在城建上，奇观到了地图上，而区域也成为了城建的核心之一
加上更为复杂的战斗系统、水源、电力和娱乐设施覆盖网络、区域和地面设施的加成等等
让玩家在铺设城市时要考虑诸多的因素，比起5代来说城市规划的乐趣要大很多

另外，6代比起5代还增加了许多新内容，电力系统、摇滚乐队、气候变化、结盟系统、总督、更多的城邦内容、近未来科技文化等等
大多数新内容都很有趣且对游戏进程会有很大影响


[b]游戏性（战争）[/b]

Civ 6 ★★★★
Civ 5 ★★

相较5代，6代的战争系统取得了长足的进步
比起5代占据了游戏几乎大部分时间的过强的步弓和海军体系，6代在兵种的选择上丰富了很多
轻骑兵重骑兵的各种升级选项让它们都颇巨战略价值，绕后突袭和骚扰成为非常有效的战术
而且诸如轻骑兵的升级树，有作为突袭部队和掠夺骚扰的两种类型，可以让玩家根据形势去选择用法
虽然19年6月的更新后，辅助攻城器械无法再作用于骑兵，使得偷城几乎成为了不可能
但战略资源的更改，使得文艺复兴时期不再完全依赖硝石，而可以使用骑兵作为辅助战力

远程单位则变得更为脆弱，这使得玩家得更注重阵型和对侧翼及后方的保护
步兵依然是中坚力量，但移动消耗的变更让其变得更为笨重
抗骑兵成为了另一种步兵，除了对抗骑兵的优秀效果，其不消耗战略资源的特点也让玩家在任何时候都可以选择抗骑兵加远程单位作为防守力量
中世纪后，城墙也变得异常坚硬，攻城炮成为了从文艺复兴到轰炸机之前正面攻城的必备选项
海军依然是同时代的最强，但前期着重大陆发展玩家可以通过避免建设临海城来躲过游戏中期的海上争霸，并在后期通过近海城的港口重新抢夺制海权
最后，空军也终于成为了战场的主宰力量，而不是5代里连同时代步兵都打不过的玩具

除了兵种终于做到了多样性
各种战争的新设定也让一些5代里实用但无趣的设定退出了舞台
首先，颇具随机性，但对游戏进程却又异常有决定意义的大将军地堡被彻底移除
新军营机制（XP获取率）、更实用的单位升级树和自带回血，也让玩家不再选择5代里升级后留点回血的打法
此外，新的厌战设定、与外交点数挂钩的不满度也终于让野蛮5向5文明6迈进了一步
厌战机制、光头总督、军营和强力的高等级城墙等让游戏中做足准备的防守方有了巨大的优势，也让5代里堆大将军地堡和步兵海推进的战术彻底被淘汰
尝试战争、无法达到战略目后进行和谈这样的“文明”行为终于也可以在玩家对战间可以出现了

此外，设计师在6代的更新中也在优化战争系统
战略资源作为进攻方几乎必备的物品，很大程度上限制了早期版本插卡收割爆兵一波的打法
也使得玩家在进行战争前需要更处心积虑的做战争准备
无论是向其他玩家购买战略资源、使用红卡提高资源产出、或是使用总督来减少资源消耗
准备进攻战争的玩家都需要做比插卡爆兵多得多的战略准备，这也让战争从准备的过程就开始变得扣人心弦


[b]AI[/b]

Civ 6 ★
Civ 5 ★

虽然游戏性上进步很大，但作为一款主要面向单机玩家的游戏，原封不动的继承5代糟糕的AI是令人愤怒和难以置信的
军事单位的魔幻走位，连新手玩家都能做得更好的城市布局和发展方式，莫名其妙的领袖性格和议程
当熟悉了游戏机制后，哪怕有时候想尝试点新东西，或者给自己添加诸多限制
没有任何挑战的“神级”AI也会让你进入打单机半小时就想退出的窘境


[b]联机模式[/b]

Civ 6 ★★★★★
Civ 5 ★

虽然AI还是很糟糕，但新的联机模式多少给了我安慰，这也是我认为6代较之5代可玩性更大的一个原因
首先，最关键的稳定性终于做到了一个多人游戏该有的水准
5代的例行性游戏崩溃不见了，断线重连持续崩溃的问题也得到了解决
虽然还有偶尔卡BUG的情况，但6代稳定的断线重连基本都可以让玩家解决这些小故障

另外，网络的性能也得到了提高
5代木桶效应的联机模式，即除开Host之外所有玩家的网络连接质量等同于网络延迟最差的玩家的连接质量
变成了玩家的网络质量都各自根据自身和Host独立的连接质量决定

在游戏内容上，较之5代自闭的打法，6代的商路机制、盟友系统、战略资源、外交系统、更有影响力的世界议会等等让玩家的互动变得更有实际价值
加之之前提到的厌战机制，以及邻近城市不同玩家间的区域甚至可以互相加成等设定，也鼓励玩家进行敌友转化，将前期战争的对手变成后期的盟友
而且，相较5代经常死于野蛮玩家的手中，6代强大的防御机制也让新手玩家可以选择防守性打法
更容易存活到后期游戏，并通过外交和结盟等获得游戏乐趣

最后，联机UI方面也有很大进步
19年两次小更新的，比如资源和单位的检索、地图标记和玩家信息图表都让玩家的交流更为方便
并让玩家可以一目了然的看到所有文明的军事值等数据，这更节省了联机模式下玩家到处翻看资料的操作和时间


[b]画面[/b]

Civ 6 ★★★
Civ 5 ★★★★★

如前面所说，比起5代，6代的UI有了很大进步，更美观也更方便
但除了UI之外，其它方面的美工变化并不是很合我个人的主观口味
虽然图像更为细腻了，但整个游戏的图像变成了一种圆润油腻而光亮的卡通风，在表现力上似乎不进反退
奇观的3D建造过程很有趣，但5代让我流连忘返的油画CG不见了
还有一些细节，比如5代在文明选择的界面，可以看到一张该文明某个时代颇具风格的疆域地图，这种细节在6代也是没有的
而这些细节的缺失加上卡通的风格，让我感觉在“文明”这个主题的代入感上有所欠缺


[b]音乐[/b]

Civ 6 ★★★
Civ 5 ★★★★★

比起5代的战争与和平两种变奏，6代变成了四个不同时代的变奏，但没有了地图的泛文化背景音乐
我不是专业音乐人，但个人直观的感受是，6代有很多优秀的曲子，但听上去的感觉没5代值得回味
只能说5代的音乐实在太优秀了




总的来说，较之前作，6代虽然AI依然弱智，但联机性能大幅度增强，也增添了大量的新内容和可玩性
所以如果你有几个实力旗鼓相当的朋友可以同乐，入手6代肯定是没错的
但如果你是单机玩家，可以权衡一下是否对6代的新内容感兴趣，因为单机模式对熟悉了文明系列的老玩家来说可能并不十分耐玩

另外还想提一点的是，较之5代BNW后敷衍的更新，6代GS后的小更新都颇为良心
无论是细节的优化还是平衡的更新，都看得出制作组花了不少心思想在让这个游戏变得更好

49270894.review:
EDIT: PLEASE go and read the comments. I still feel that my review is valid, but the comments give an amazing variety of perspectives that I also feel need to be heard. Thank you in advance. 

--------------------------------------------------------

To everyone jumping on the EULA band wagon, I just want to provide some facts that you can check out for yourself. If you're still mad after that, totally fine, but just hear me out.

[olist]
[*] The section that people keep quoting is [b][u]NOT[/u][/b] from Civ 6's EULA. It is from take 2's privacy policy (the parent company for 2k) which can be found here: [url=https://www.take2games.com/privacy/] https://www.take2games.com/privacy/ [/url] This means a few things.
[list]
[*]This is also not "new" at all. The last change made to the take 2 privacy policy was in May 8, 2018 (at the time of writing this review). I have literally no idea where people are getting the notion that this was changed in accordance with Gathering Storm, but these policies have been applying to you that entire time.
[*]This policy applies to every single take 2 game. That means it applies to any Rockstar game (so time to hang up your cowboy hats and rocket cars), any 2k game (say goodbye to Rapture, Thin Men, and any incarnation of Nuclear Gandhi), and the brand new title by obsidian: Outer Worlds. Every single one of these games is affected by that privacy policy, not just Civ 6. The "most helpful review" states that he has played his last game of civ 6... well then I guess he's played his last game of all of these as well.
[*] It's not just written for games. This policy also applies to their storefront (the reason that they need to collect payment information) as well as any forums or sweepstakes (the reason they might need your address, if they need to ship you something). 
[/list]

[*] Take 2's privacy policy is not radical at all. If you look at Ubisoft ( [url=https://legal.ubi.com/privacypolicy/en-GB] https://legal.ubi.com/privacypolicy/en-GB [/url] ) or even steam ( https://store.steampowered.com/privacy_agreement/ ) there is a lot of incredibly similar language. If you don't want to read it all just control F some keywords. If these privacy statements frighten you, go and look up the producers of your favorite games, because there is a very good chance that they have a similar privacy policy.

[*] The section that the "Most Helpful Review" quotes is taken horribly out of context. He takes it from the "What Personal and Other Information Does the Company Collect" section. At first glance that sounds like exactly the right context, until you look closer. He starts his quote right after this: "The types of information collected in connection with the activities listed above will vary depending on the activity" What activities you might ask? ANYTHING. 

Literally any interaction you might have with the company is listed above, from requesting tech support, to purchasing a product in the store, to subscribing to a newsletter. The people review bombing this game are trying to make it seem like this policy turns the game into some sort of spyware, sniffing out your personal details. In fact, the most helpful review PURPOSEFULLY misleads you to garner more fear. He specifically states the game is collecting your address (it is included in his quote that is taken out of context). However, this is directly contradicted by the "What Gameplay Information Does the Company Collect?" Section, where they state very plainly that they do not collect your name or address during gameplay.

[/olist]


Look, I'm not saying that you aren't allowed to be mad or suspicious, but please, do research and think critically before your are led into being mad for the wrong reasons.


-----------------------------------------------------------


EDIT: Also, one of the top reviews mentions a web process running in the background which I can find absolutely NO evidence of. Again, fact check these people. It's a little strange that the top three reviews spreading this misinformation all have their comments turned off...




2nd EDIT: Firstly, thank you to everyone who voted me helpful, I love that this post is getting more comments and discussion.

Many people in the comments seem to think I am defending take 2's policy. I can completely understand how that might come off, but that is not my intention. 

My entire point in making this post was to highlight the fact that this is not specifically a civ 6 problem, but rather an industry problem. That is why I said at the beginning and end that it is totally reasonable to be mad, but to make sure that you understand the full scope of the situation. I LOVE the debate in my comments, because it means that people are thinking critically about the problem rather than taking any of the reviews at face value.

Also, many are calling my separation of EULA and privacy policy misleading, since the former has to be adherent to the later. Again, the reason I am hitting this point so hard is because I am trying to hit home the fact that this is not a civ 6 issue, it is an issue that encompasses the entire company.

I personally feel that the top negative reviews mislead in that they insinuate that if you avoid civ 6, you avoid the problem, which simply isn't true.

I also want to address the fact that my review is positive. I like civ 6 and will continue to play it, that is the entire reason that it is positive, because I like the game. 

I personally do not agree with the sentiment that a negative review of a game that a company makes is an appropriate way to speak your mind about the company, but honestly if I were in a more personal debate I can see my mind being changed. That being said, the current negative reviews do not paint an accurate picture of the situation and there is no place to correct them since their comments are turned off. This post is meant to be a public discussion of the issue so that we can all share our opinions, rather than just have one person shouting without anyone being able to respond.



3rd EDIT: Again, love the discussion, keep it up guys <3

I want to make it clear, my admonishment of the other reviews posted is not because they are negative, it is because they are claiming that this incident is isolated to Civ 6 when it just isn't. I'm not going to change my original post, because I want peoples comments to always make sense so that newcomers can follow the conversation.

I also want to clarify that my confusion and reason for this post is due to the fact that it is being singled out as opposed to any other take2 game. Some have rightfully pointed out that this is simply the newest and freshest on the scene, so it's a better place to make complaints. I would actually heartily agree with that sentiment if all of the reviews made it clear who is really at fault here: TAKE 2 GAMES. Unfortunately they do not.

To @awkwardpaws specifically, I feel for you. I hate that many here feel like they do not have a voice or a place to speak their mind. This is why I was so irritated with the lack of a comment sections on the other posts. I have also made an edit to the top of this review to encourage people to read the comments. YOU are the ones that people need to here from, not me. Keep it up guys.

35599147.review:
tl;dr: Just play Civ V instead.

Well, I've been trying to love this game for 642 hours now (as opposed to 3532 hours wasted/enjoyed in Civ V). Some observations about this game as it stands alone, now that the adjustment period from Civ V is out of the way:

 - AI's military tactics are still extremely weak. It does not assemble its units for advantage, attack when it has the advantage, or defend its cities effectively. You'd think a fundamental goal for any game like this would be to have fronts naturally develop, as in a real-life war. Nope. Scattered, random skirmishes that the AI always loses. You can run the map with 1-2 infantry or cavalry units, plus 1 artillery.
 - Diplomacy mechanics bring nothing to the game. If you so much as defend yourself or retaliate against an aggressor, as one does in war, you're branded a warmonger. Were the Allies warmongers in WWII for conquering Germany? Leaders relentlessly spam you with their disapproval, consuming ridiculous numbers of UI-animation seconds before you can esc/cancel with each one. Despite claims that leaders approve of certain things, it seems to be an either/or, all-or-nothing, hair-trigger mechanism. A leader will love you one turn and denounce you the next, because they expected you to have one more military unit that turn or something. There is no nuance, spectrum, or "scoring" to this system, as far as I can tell, contrary to the claim that there are several levels between "friendly" and "denounced." It's a waste of effort to try to get along with everyone while trying to win a science or cultural victory. Just let them inevitably declare war and fight them off.
 - Firaxis has figured out how to make leader interactions annoy you further and waste even more of your time. Clearly, you want to be spammed with an inconsequential 30-second message for "good job" "or "I hate you" several times each turn - often interrupting your next click - and wait an additional several seconds for it to respond to multiple Esc presses.
 - The AI engine is SLOW. I've played on an i7-5930k and an i7-6850k, and on both, it takes up to a minute to process AI turns in late game. I think most hours spent playing this game are for the "please wait" stage. Why Firaxis cannot take advantage of parallel processing, or cache possible scenarios in advance while you're taking your turn, I do not know. There should at least be an option (or default) where other player moves have faster animations so that you can see what's happening without losing time, without making all the animations bizarrely short like in quick combat.
 - The lack of automated builders brings more tedium to the game than it does craftsmanship. In late game, I really no longer care about the details of each city; there are no real mistakes to be made, and I do not want to micromanage every single tile of every single city on a standard to huge map. Keeping the charge mechanic on builders, but adding an option to automate (or making it a technology, like a "self-reliance" civic) would probably still encourage early game caretaking, while removing late game tedium.
 - The game in general just feels slow and tedious. This is in no small part due to terrain penalties and weak road bonuses for unit movement. (And the fact you essentially can't deliberately construct roads; military engineer roads are too expensive.) Even in the middle ages, no, it didn't take 20 years for a unit to cross a civilization. It takes a lot of the oomph and fun out of army mobilization when it's far more practical to move single powerful units against the weak AI than to assemble melee and archer units into a tactically appropriate formation. There's simply no reason to bother with a combined arms / blitzkrieg approach in this game.
 - I like the districts mechanic in principle, but it's not flexible enough. Districts should be removable at a cost, or at the VERY least, there should be more information displayed in early game about the future optimal options for each tile. It's really not fun to try to wing it and guess where it will be best to place an industrial, commercial, or theater district in the future, before you can select those districts to see the adjacency bonuses. (Or for placing future wonders, each of which have strict, arbitrary requirements.) At the very least, there should be some sort of filter (a lens?) to display all adjacency bonuses on a tile.
 - Tile info popovers are slow and unreliable. Just show the dang info when I mouse over. I'm not afraid. At least make it so that mousing over a resource icon by accident doesn't prevent tile info from displaying until I leave the tile and reenter.
 - Personally, I think the air unit mechanics in this game feel awkward and unnatural. Why not just emulate real life instead? Carriers in real life can project power farther and to more places at once than allowed by the 2 short-range aircraft, as can air bases. Jet fighters intercept attacks, like in Civ V. They don't sit there and take it. No cruise missiles or ballistic conventional weapons in this game? They do exist in real life... Also, by the time you can build aerodromes and project significant air power, you could far more easily have created 3 times as many land units of greater power. The air game seems to be rather pointless, and is placed too late in the game in terms of military advancement. Air units are too weak for the time they take to acquire. Minor note: you'd also think cheap surveillance or attack drones would be making an appearance by now.
 - Nuclear weapons are thankfully a little more realistic in this game, since they really ruin whatever land you'd like to conquer, but at the same time, you've got to ask, of what use are they in the game? The AI never has a powerful enough conventional army where you'd need nukes to defend yourself. Since you can conquer all other civs with 3 army units, it's foolish to nuke them first and ruin your takings. Best guess, if you're trying to win a science or cultural victory, you'd like to ruin everyone else's day? If you're in the mood to go for one of those victories, initiating nuclear war doesn't really fit the bill.
 - In my experience, all games devolve into domination matches. As soon as someone attacks you (inevitable), you will have an army and be branded a warmonger for defending yourself. So you might as well remove the nuisance of neighboring civs who like to attack you. Nature then takes its course. Maybe this is a bit realistic, but it doesn't exactly meet the 4x, varied experience Firaxis is trying to accomplish.
 - City state and liberation mechanics are flawed. There is no real way to defend an allied city state, or even just to play peacekeeper. You're not notified that they are attacked, and you are not given any casus belli for declaring war. War of liberation (after the fact) also doesn't seem to become available when it should. If you do liberate a city, all your units are immediately expelled from that territory, bizarrely and unnaturally disrupting your advance in a way that just wouldn't happen in real life. Takes the fun out of liberating that neighboring continent that had been conquered by a single civ; liberating France as in WWII is literally impossible.
 - So tired of hearing "best not to aid that city state" from other leaders. What are you talking about? I didn't aid any city state. Which one???
 - The tech/civic boost mechanic is neat, but it makes games far too uneven. Either I hit all the boosts by the luck of the map and launch a moon landing or accidentally win a culture victory in 1700, or I'm tied up in a war for 500 years (in which I can't go on the offensive to end it or else become a warmonger), miss a lot of the boosts, and discover petroleum in 1960.

I fired up this game this morning on a sick day to pass the time, and found that it's more fun to write this review than to sit through any more hours with the game. That should tell you something.

40674656.review:
[h1]一。少时回忆[/h1]

　　我对《文明》系列游戏总有一种道不清言不明的特殊情愫。到底源自哪呢？扪心自问，似乎是自小对历史的浓厚兴趣所致。

　　历史的兴趣应该来自家里的藏书。我家是农民出身，并非书香门第，爷爷奶奶大字不识，父亲年轻时为了走出农村（在当时其实是很朴素的想法：填饱肚子，养活家人。），他锲而不舍的为着这个目标奋斗着，先是跑去参军（参军有补贴，还能吃饱饭），退伍回来又去镇子上的铁厂当工人，之后一面工作，一面自学去参加刚恢复不久的高考，最后考上了心仪的大学，在而立之年终于成功走出了农村，在城里落了户。

　　父亲在生活稳定下来后，就把自己喜欢读书的爱好，延伸发展到藏书上。那个年代单位分配的房子空间不足，身为工程师的父亲也只有一室一厅，他就执意安排了其中一间做书房，全家三口人一起挤到另一间。父亲还定制了一个现在看来很丑但是超大的木制书柜，差不多有书房一半大小。到我开始读书识字时，书柜已经摆满了各种书，可谓五花八门。按体裁来说，有小说，文集，诗歌，有传记，书信，有文言文，也有白话文，甚至还有好几本英语书。

　　工具书，大部头的有《辞源》和《辞海》，中等个头有《现代汉语词典》，当然少不了那个年代家家户户都有一本的《新华字典》。诗歌我记得就有好几册，不只有《唐诗三百首》，还有好几本宋词和清诗。就小说而言，中国古典长篇小说四大名著，自然少不了，因为当时父亲在长沙就读的大学，自然都是岳麓书社版本。此外历史，传奇，言情的小说，都不少。那时还没出现现在流行的玄幻和穿越类别，不过国外的科幻小说和中国传统武侠小说倒有不少。

　　书房里的那个大书柜对于渐渐识字的我来说，就象一个巨大的宝库。在我读初中之前，父亲一直把书房当作禁脔，估计是怕我少不更事，在里面搞破坏，就不容许我单独进入。有一回发现我在里面偷偷看书，他一语不发直接用皮带抽了我个半死。不过我属皮猴（皮厚），抓耳捞腮更想一探究竟，心痒痒的，越打越来劲了。“不怕贼偷，就怕贼惦记”，“家贼难防”，终于在我读到初中时，父亲找到我，语重心长的同我说了一番话：“读书人要爱惜书，绝不能毁坏书。”这也是我长那么大，他对我提出的唯一要求。

　　那时，父亲在家门口栽下两颗巨峰葡萄（这里葡萄的故事之前说过），隔不久又种下了两盆月季。你别说，我所在的这个城市的市花就是月季，不过父亲的潜台词我是一目了然，绝非是为了美观，我瞧见月季茎干上浑身的刺，一下就明悟到了他的良苦用心。这枝条用剪刀剪下来，抽到身上绝不是皮带可能比的，绝对疼入骨髓。随着月季陆续抽出新枝，我也很快就懂事了。

　　待到父亲准许我进书房看书，我才真正了解到父亲对书有多么喜爱。他是真的很爱惜书，书柜里的一些旧书有的已有十多年历史，还是保管得完好无损。甚至家里大多数藏书都舍不得署名，有些年头的书，父亲还细心的用牛皮纸自制了封皮，给它们套上新装。父亲勤于打扫，书房一贯保持窗明几净，大书柜装潢的透明玻璃也是一尘不染，明亮如镜。父亲也不只是把书当宝贝养着，他平常也经常看书，手不释卷。不过家里的书绝少有折页的痕迹，为防自己忘记看到何处，父亲还特意手工自制了好几枚书签，上面是漂亮的钢笔手书，写得都是勉励人上进的名人名言，码成一排整齐摆放在书柜的架子上。现在每每在书房看到那几枚书签，就忆起父亲，不能自已。

　　父亲的书对我影响最大的当属中国古典四大名著，其中又以《三国演义》影响最为深刻。《三国演义》以蜀汉为正统，自然我读书也先入为主，跟着公瑾痛斥曹操“名为汉相，实为汉贼”，同蜀汉“同呼吸，共命运”了。每每为长坂坡上赵子龙，为他七进七出的英勇无畏而击节叫好；读到夷陵之战时，为刘皇叔的刚愎自用痛心疾首；为蜀汉的二世祖刘禅，也就是后世有名的“扶不起的阿斗”，为他宠幸宦官，荒废朝政而义愤填膺，恨不得自己能取而代之；更为五丈原诸葛丞相“出师未捷身先死”扼腕叹息，真想抢先一步挡住踢翻七星灯的魏延。每每感慨蜀汉前期虎将云集的大好局面，一步步沦落到到后期“蜀中无大将，廖化作先锋”，几多“老兵不死，只是慢慢凋零凋零”，真是“无可奈何花落去”，“此情可待成追忆”。

　　在当时，现在流行的手机、电脑、网络，这些如今稀疏平常的娱乐活动还未普及，那时作为求知若渴的少年，最为留恋的就是父亲的书房。当然现在我年纪也尚浅，人生阅历仍不够，还不敢妄言父亲的书对我的人生道路造成了最大的影响，但起码让我对历史方面培养了浓厚的兴趣。特别是《三国演义》里“智近乎妖”的诸葛亮，“运筹帷幄之中，决胜千里之外”，料敌如神，排兵布阵，更是让我崇拜莫名。这跟回合制的历史题材策略游戏真是完美契合，所以历史题材的策略游戏总是让我更为青睐。最早由传奇游戏设计大师席德·梅尔创作出来的《文明》就是一款这样的回合制策略游戏，玩《文明》总能给玩家一种亲手缔造历史的感觉，这可能是其区别于其他游戏给玩家带来的最大感受。

[h1]二。“再来一回合！”[/h1]

　　此外《文明》系列游戏里面还藏有一个心理暗示。对大多数人而言，当距离某个目标很接近时，常常会先关注完成这个似乎在“顷刻间就能完成”的目标，而忽略去做其他事情。这种心理暗示还能同时形成一种粘性，故而经常被应用于社交型网站和网络/网页/手机游戏。例如很多网站（或是游戏）为保留人气，设置了几分钟到几十分钟只需在线即可领取的小福利，这些在线任务特别是起始的任务要求都很低，但是玩家却会因此而显著降低离开意愿，不知不觉之下就会滞留于网站，这样就会对这个网站产生粘性，而这种粘性一旦形成，很快会转化成个人习惯，增强对网站的亲和度，最终就会习以为常，常驻于此。

　　而《文明》系列游戏深谙其道，游戏的进程被游戏设计师巧妙拆解为一个个小目标。首先，达成这些小目标就能获得不错的满足感和成就感，以及在游戏内立竿见影的各种加成。其次，这些目标的达成条件大多不会很高，一般只需历经数个回合即可轻松完成。比如游戏里最为典型也最为大家青睐的修筑各种“奇观”，只要你开的游戏设置得不是“马拉松”模式，一般少量回合后就能自动完成。第三，在达成一个目标后，游戏的设定又能让玩家轻松找到下一个新目标。这样一来，“one more turn”就开始了无限循环。正因如此，《文明》系列游戏，被很多玩家冠之以“有毒”，一旦开玩就根本停不下来。《文明5》就曾让我非常沉迷，总是睡前立旗说“再来一个回合就睡觉”，结果常常一不留神就玩到深夜两三点，甚至通宵达旦。

[h1]三。《文明6》个人点评[/h1]

　　以下为《文明6》的个人点评：主要是一些个人不太满意的地方。

A。《文明6》游戏画风突变，从之前偏重冷色调的写实风格，变成Q版和暖色调为主，有些过于突兀。游戏里的历史人物，设置过于卡通风，加上炫彩得过度显得太过明亮的画风，加上Q版的战斗模型，对于一款历史题材的游戏来说，个人实在不敢恭维，历史的凝重和沉淀的质感损失殆尽，很容易让玩家脱戏，没有代入感。

B。出于对开发商的信任和IP的口碑，很多玩家抢先购买了《文明6 数字豪华版》，结果同捆销售方案，让豪华版的高昂费用与附赠低廉且劣质的DLC包，两者形成鲜明对比，“我本将心向明月，奈何明月照沟渠”，这样的结果惹怒了很多玩家，成了彻底的营销失败案例。而愿意购买豪华版的玩家，大多属于有购买力又愿意支持游戏的忠实粉丝，无脑去得罪这些玩家，就需要花费更多工夫才能挽回口碑。

C。虽然现在《文明6》的数量和种类已经足够丰富，但是各个文明之间的个性依然不够鲜明，对于大多数文明和领袖而言，还是需要设定加入更明显的个性，不仅仅是几条特性，或是改几个模型和图形就能简单建构的，需要在文明的日常行事时，加入更多更明显的特征，在不断推出新的文明包圈钱的同时，急需降低文明的同质化和滥用。不然真不如玩家在创意工坊里自制的优秀mod。

D。游戏的游戏性，现在来说实在不够好。虽然每开一局新游戏都是随机地图，随机AI，但是玩到中期依然千篇一律，很容易腻味。

目前来说，战狂AI过于强势，而其他以宗教和文化为特色类型的文明前期太过弱势。
谴责被AI滥用。启动机制简直是一塌糊涂，错到离谱。
而同盟又太过简单，只要刚遇上的AI，一旦友宣通过，可以维持到游戏结束，甚至还是近邻。
城邦难以立足，基本都是被AI吊打，免不了迅速覆灭的宿命。后期好多围绕城邦设置的新颖设定，完全没了用处。

AI恶心之极的随意铺城。什么AI都喜欢玩爆铺，一眼望去密密麻麻，草木皆兵，真是设定失败。而且大多是没有必要的乱铺，若是说周围有什么特色资源，或是战略要地就算了，AI铺成一片，只是压缩玩家空间，外带玩一玩“连连看”吧。

有些AI设计就是为了恶心玩家，建议以后尽量弱化和减少AI在这些方面的行为和设定。特别是对玩家成就感最高的“奇观”，现在想跟AI抢奇观真不容易。其实大家都知道“奇观误国”，但是依然乐此不疲，只因这是玩家很容易从奇观中获得满足感。而这一代里修筑奇观，费时费力不说，建成之后加成效果不明显，难度高一些，AI还经常跑去抢建奇观，这无疑是在扼杀游戏性，降低玩家的成就感。

毕竟不是每个玩家都是神级策略玩家，大多数玩家没有那么强的计算和策略能力。

　　或许是“爱之深，责之切”，我对《文明》系列游戏既有少时的情怀，又有过对前作废寝忘食的沉迷，故而期望很高，就像亲密老友之间，直言不讳，少用褒赞溢美之词，其实《文明6》里的优点也有很多。

下面简略说说：
比如能把人类宏大的文明史，和各个经典文明融入到一款回合制策略游戏里，这一点殊为不易。
画风也许见仁见智，也有不少玩家喜欢新的卡通风格。
而且游戏的优化相较于前作来说，好了不止一个档次。前作《文明5》很吃配置，到后期低配置的电脑运作起来很费时间，而《文明6》改善了许多。我的老电脑玩《文明6》比《文明5》更流畅。

[h1]四。《文明VI 迭起兴衰》说明和点评[/h1]

OK，接下来说说《文明6》的新资料片《文明VI 迭起兴衰》的改进，均有配图说明。新资料片的设计主旨：“以系统丰富的主游戏为基础，拓展出全新的游戏机制，力求带来前所未有的游戏体验。”

1.加入的新功能

A。时代：历史浮沉、潮起潮落，文明将到达阶段性的历史时刻，进入黑暗时代或黄金时代。根据玩家在游戏中进行的不同操作，不同时代将提供特定的挑战或加成。成功度过黑暗时代后，下个黄金时代将更为辉煌——其称之为英雄时代。

时代加入好评，等于加入了更多的策略性。玩家可以审时度势，争取自己扮演的文明进入黄金时代，加速发展，这等于扩展了全新的游戏玩法，不至于每局千篇一律，以至于审美疲劳。

B。忠诚度：您治下的城市现在有各自的忠诚度。若忠诚度跌得太低，城市有可能自行独立。记住，别人的失败就是您的快乐。您可以靠着获得地图上其他自由城市的忠诚来扩展疆土。

忠诚度是衡量城市公民对文明依附强度的标尺。如忠诚度归零，城市将奋起反抗并成为自由城市。其他文明则可借机通过武力或忠诚度压力将其纳入。

这一设定限制了千里拍城的打法，也遏制了部分无脑战狂玩法，还算OK。特别是占据了重要城市之后，对周边中小城市的忠诚度辐射影响，可以“不战而屈人之兵”，这一点不错。

C。总督：总督拥有独特的加成和升级树。您可以招募、指定和升级这种强力角色，使城市更具特色，并稳定公民的忠诚度。

还算不错的新功能。游戏加入了7位特色鲜明的总督，每位皆有其自身的特色升级树。总督还可稳定城市的忠诚度。是选择单一强化某位总督，还是让你的城市遍布多位低级总督，嗯，这是一个问题。需要注意的是，给新城市分派总督，需要数个回合才能就职。

D。强化同盟：强化的同盟系统使玩家可以建立不同类型的同盟，并获得加成。

这个是对前作里同盟设定的回归和强化。一共有研究、文化、军事、宗教、经济5项同盟，每种同盟有3个等级。因为每种同盟仅限结缔一个，所以你想跟其他文明缔结何种同盟，跟你玩的路线有关，如果你想玩科技胜利，自然是多跟其他文明缔结研究同盟，其他类推。

E。紧急状况：某个文明过于强大、对各方形成威胁时，其他文明则可以联合起来对抗。紧急情况结束后将根据实际情况判定奖励和惩罚。

玩家刚遇到估计会一脸懵逼，比如我在游戏里头一回碰到，触发条件是AI的蒙古文明灭了一个叫格拉纳达城邦，就宣布进入紧急状况。问题是紧急状况画面弹出来时，又不让点世界地图，我压根不知道他们在哪。然后看界面，误以为其他文明会跟我一起，只要我振臂一呼反抗暴权，他们就会加入正义的一方，一同谴责和打击蒙古，就想当然点了参加。结果其他AI全都不吭气，就我傻愣愣的宣战蒙古了，被打的满头包，还达不成目标。结果是就我一个文明宣战了蒙古，胜利条件是解救那个城邦，问题根本不在一个大陆，而当时我根本就不具备跨海作战的能力和条件，代价自然是高昂且惨痛的。

F。年表：新加入的年表功能以历史时刻展现文明迈向胜利的前进道路，便于玩家随时查看历史进程。

成就满满。前提是你能获得胜利。

G。新领袖和文明：新加入8个文明和9位领袖，以及8个特色单位、2个特色建筑、4个特色改良设施和2个特色区域，带来花样繁多的加成和玩法。

等于加入了几个小文明包。

H。新内容：新加入8个世界奇观、7个自然奇观、4个单位、2个改良设施、2个区域、14个建筑和3个资源。

奇观误国啊！多少次因为贪图修建奇观，以至被敌国兵临城下，不得已停止修筑，改弦易辙生产民兵，结果付出惨烈代价打退敌军，彼时却跳出一条信息：某某文明已经建成了这一奇观！还好，我的鼠标质量不错，耐摔！

2。游戏机制改良：政体系统加入了更多新政策；其他游戏系统也得到了改良。

一些平衡和优化。

3。此外，《文明VI 迭起兴衰》资料片其他一些改进的地方还有：

A。对游戏界面和UI也有一些调整。

个人感觉城市显示人口的UI有些过小，似乎有不显示现有金币的BUG。

B。历史时刻

好评。等于每隔数个回合就会给你大唱赞歌。毕竟历史时刻太容易实现了。

C。时代得分

这是资料片里有关“时代”部分的评分，这是事关走在时代前言，是进入黄金还是黑暗时代非常重要的指标。

　　以上列举和分析了《文明VI 迭起兴衰》资料片的诸多好处，但是实话实说，就是加上新出的《文明VI 迭起兴衰》资料片，目前就游戏性来说，《文明6》的可玩性依然远远不如《文明5》。

　　由上可见，《文明VI 迭起兴衰》加入了相当多的新功能，且进行了游戏性进行了不少革新和扩展，不过因为原本游戏的一些缺陷，新资料片又没有对之进行相应的修复，而加入新功能又随之放大了部分缺陷，所以游戏的核心游戏性依然不高。

　　真可惜啊，之前《文明6》本体挖的坑太大，特别是《文明5》等前作珠玉在前，宛若高山仰止，如今的《文明6》绝非一个大型补丁可以轻易挽回口碑的。

[h1]五。对《文明6》未来改进的个人建议[/h1]

　　个人对《文明6》未来改进的一些见解，这里就不谈对游戏基本机制和设定的各种平衡和更新，毕竟游戏开发商才是专业的，我在这里只泛泛而谈游戏未来可以改进的方向。

1。希望能个性化和区别化一些文明。当然如果文明数量太多，要让每个文明都个性分明，也不容易，但是可以用以下两种方式建立更鲜明的个性。
A。可以把大多数文明，按照一些类型进行归类，比如文明历史上的对外侵略倾向，分为“战狂型”或是“种田型”，或者依据文明后续发展类型，分为“贸易型”、“文化型”或是“科技型”。这样给这些类型标注一些基本发展特征，这样就易于区别了。起码一个在历史上并无对外侵略的文明，在游戏里疯狂爆铺暴兵对外侵略，总是看着违和感十足。
B。可以把其中一些更为著名更显赫的文明，作为代表加入更鲜明的特征，对外扩张的进攻型文明，惯于建立特大城市的文明，喜欢发展拱卫首都卫城的文明等等。

2。多一些剧情向的单人战役DLC，人类历史上，太多的文明璀璨夺目，不止有那些一些存续至今的文明，更有一些已经泯灭消亡在历史长河中。这些都可以挖掘制作成剧情DLC，这些绝对比滥发其他文明受玩家青睐。

3。现在竞技游戏非常吃香。当然，现在《文明6》里面已经有多人模式，不过是否可以向竞技方面发展一下呢？比如建立非常公平的竞技地图供玩家竞技。随机是很棒，对单人模式来说，但是如果不再使用完全随机的模式，而是固定的文明起始点，把上面第1点建议里的某一类文明代表拿出来加入玩家可选，可以对战，可以攻略固定城邦，或是限时模式，或是竞时模式。大有可为。

4。目前宗教系统形同鸡肋，希望能进行改进。历史上，佛教和道教等宗教并不主要以战争和对外侵略进行传播，而基督教和伊斯兰教都有很多圣战，或许可以从某方面着手，进行区分，当然这是个敏感话题，如果会造成争议，那就还是直接使用前作玩家更认可的宗教系统好了。

　　与其拼命推新的文明包圈钱，遭玩家诟病，不如先沉下心来，好好完善和平衡游戏的基础设定，再针对目前玩家质疑的部分好好完善，可能更为合适。

[h1]六。结尾[/h1]

　　如果你没玩过《文明》系列，那《文明6》绝对很适合你。如果你是《文明》系列的骨灰级玩家，那不妨再耐心等一等，不过我还对《文明》系列报以厚望，无论是后续《文明6》续出优质DLC涤旧而生新，还是之后推出更好的续作，《文明》系列游戏王者归来，我绝不意外。

　　或许开一局游戏，其实不一定只有游戏胜利才算赢，就是输掉了游戏，若能从中享受到游戏里文明跌宕起伏而来的文化底蕴和历史积淀，也是一种赢吧。有时候，心境变一变，看法转一转，“成大事者，不计一城一池之得失”，真能做到“退一步海阔天空”，就能从中领悟到更多收获吧。

38702928.review:
看到文明6这么多差评，我也来写一份测评给没买游戏的玩家吧


==============================前言================================

本人是不资深高玩甚至算不上是fans，和没买游戏的你们一样，属于对文明这种战棋策略类有兴趣的玩家，一年多前在自己另外一个号上面预购了豪华版文明，一年来文明6确实没有多大进步，对于豪华版玩家对游戏dlc内容的不满，表示这种落差可以理解，[spoiler]但是既然你选择了预购豪华版，你就要做好心理准备，否则你就该等游戏全出了，看完评测后再买。[/spoiler]所以刷差评发泄也是非常正常的行为，但是会误导一部份新的没有购买的玩家，对游戏的看法。

==============================导购================================

如果你喜欢欧陆战争，三国志，太空4a系列，钢铁雄心这类游戏的话那文明这个游戏也会合你口味，至少你可以先玩个盗版或者看看直播。如果你是文明5玩家，那你就买吧，2k不可能放弃文明，所以文明6不可能差到哪里去（结合各代口碑来看），毕竟别人团队不可能全是傻子。

我两个号买了一份豪华一份普通，就买哪个版本来说[spoiler]肯定是买本体就够了，新加的文明相信新手也不想玩，肯定上来选中国美国或者欧洲大国[/spoiler]，土豪请随意。

=============================游戏性===============================

在rise and fall 没出之前，玩法上比文明5少了不少，没了世界议会，感觉代入感少了很多，游戏性略差于文明5（毕竟6还在开发中）。但是文明6城区规划上又比文明5多了很多乐趣，[i]有点模拟城市的感觉[/i]，5代一直堆基建的玩法也有点千篇一律，6代每一个城市都变得独一无二，你很难造出两个一模一样的城市。

MOD方面开发程度都很低，可玩性高的mod我没有遇到过，只能作为游戏的调料，加一点新鲜感，聊胜于无。

游戏的玩法或者和前作游戏玩法上的改变，这里不再赘述，有兴趣的网上自己看，其实新手也没必要关注，提醒下看攻略注意日期，很多老公 [spoiler]略	[/spoiler]已经不准确了。

============================画风及AI==============================

还有评论一直批评的ai问题和画风问题，表示ai现在玩起来有一定改善，至少你会有一到两个铁兄弟（会主动联盟，并有深度合作），只要你注意看他们的议程，不要乱咬人。在这个世界，盟友本来就不会很多，难道你还指望电脑给你来一个表面兄弟[spoiler] 黑人问号？？？[/spoiler]
  
画风问题上6的画风更漂亮了，没有了历史的厚重，这点你可以从宣传片上来看，喜不喜欢这感jo看下宣传片就知道了。对于奇观控来说生动精细的建模会让奇观癌更加严重，大灯塔，百脑汇，艾菲尔铁塔，马拉卡纳球场等等奇观自带灯光，在夜晚让你的城市熠熠生辉。建模非常细致，动态时间，动态光源。你看到的不是一幅地图，而是一个动态的世界，但是卡通风格确实有违和感。

============================ 0 . 0 ==============================

买不买最好自己体验下，我只是想在差评中加一点清流，就做了点微小的工作，很惭愧。

42151458.review:
Glad someone caught the details on the EULA update from 2k. Everyone should uninstall this game, get a refund if possible, and review bomb this until 2k/firaxis gets the message and is forced to rework their EULA and privacy policy.

 Just to recap:
"INFORMATION COLLECTION & USAGE

28152243.review:
오래된 게임 시리즈의 숙명이라면, 새로운 시스템을 넣어야한다는 강박관념 때문에 갈 수록 게임은 복잡해지고, 그로 인해 하는 사람만 하게 되는 게임이 된다는 것이다.

문명 역시 4편까지는 이런 식으로 계속 복잡해져갔다. 이런 문제를 해결하기 위한 방법이었을까, 문명 5에서는 많은 부분이 편하고 이해하기 쉽게, 간단하게 만들었다. 그래서 그런지 4편의 주제가 Baba Yetu가 오히려 5편 발매 후 한국에서 유명해지는 등의 이상한 현상을 보이기도 할 정도로 문명을 즐기는 사람을이 많이 확대되었다. 

나는 문명 시리즈에서 초보자가 일정 수준 이상으로 올라갈 때 가장 장벽이 되는 것은 행복도 관리라고 봤다. 
도시가 많아지면 많아질수록 불행해지고, 과학 발전에 필요한 플라스크가 점점 더 많아진다는 개념은 넓은 나라는 통치하기 힘들다는 현실과 빗대어볼때 딱 맞는 설정이긴 했지만...

그래서 6편에서는 유구한 전통(?)을 지닌 광역 행복도를 없앤 대신, 좀 더 이해하기 쉬운 지역별 쾌적도로 바꿨으며, 도시를 늘릴 때 얻는 페널티는 없다시피 줄였다. 이로 인해 무한 확장이 매우 유리한 상황을 점하게 되어, 최대한 빨리 도시를 늘리고, 땅이 없으면 상대 문명과의 전쟁으로 넓히는, 매우 전투 지향적인 게임이 되었다. 
이렇게 바꿀꺼면, 전쟁 피로도 시스템도 좀 더 이해하기 쉽게 바꿀 수 있으면 좋았을텐데 그건 여전히 어떻게 돌아가는지 알기 힘들다. 확실하게 수치로 이야기하는 게임이 문명인 만큼, 전쟁 피로도도 더 직관적으로 해주었다면 좋았을 것이다. 

이번 작의 최대 특징인 특수지구도 역시 직관적이다. 전작을 할 때도 '이 도시는 망치(생산) 중심이니 작업장, 공장을 빨리 지어야지' 같은 식으로 이 도시는 과학 중심, 이 도시는 상업 중심' 하면서 생각하고 짓긴 했지만, 이것을 시스템화해서 넣은 것. 자신이 짓는 건물이 좀 더 큰 그래픽으로 볼 수 있다는 것도 비주얼면에서 훌륭하며, 각 도시의 특징을 보다 기억하기 쉽게 만들어주는 작은 장점도 있다고 생각한다. 

이제 단점을 꼽아보겠다. 

전투 지향적인 게임임에도 도로 강제로 짓기 같은 것이 매우 제한적이라서적과 거리가 조금만 멀거나, 언덕과 숲만 좀 있어도 이동에 매우 제약을 받는다. 전작이라면 일꾼들로 미리미리 길을 뚫어서 병력을 옮길 방법을 만들겠지만, 문명 6에서는 상인이 자동으로 뚫는 길 이외에는 공병이 지어야하지만 공병은 비싸고, 몇 블럭 도로를 놓을 수도 없다).

한편, 온라인 플레이는 상당히 잘 만들었다곤 하지만 AI와의 대전이 문명의 재미인데, 이번 AI는 스타팅 사기를 쳐도 초반을 버텨낸 인간을 이겨내질 못한다. 

그 이유는 첫째, 유레카와 영감 시스템 때문이다. 유레카는 예를 들어 '투석병으로 적을 잡으면 궁술 개발이 50% 증가' 같은 식의 시스템인데, 인간은 이걸 미리미리 생각하고 플레이하기 때문에, 가면갈수록 이게 쌓여서 고난이도에서 많은 혜택을 지니고 플레이하는 AI도 중후반부엔 인간에게 역전당하고 만다. 

두번째로는 예전부터 그랬듯, 물량으로만 승부하는 AI의 전투 지능 문제다. 원거리 병사를 효율적으로 쓰는 인간과 달리 미리 수를 잘 못 읽어서 2~3배의 물량과 한단계 업그레이드된 유닛을 지니고도 인간에게 지는 일이 허다하다. 

세번째로는, 유닛 업그레이드를 잘 활용하지 못하는 것인데, 이것은 가을 패치로 어느 정도 해결되었다곤 하지만 여전히 고대시대 전사가 원자시대 정도까진 돌아다니는 것을 자주 목격한다. 

네번째로는 특수 지구 문제. 특수 지구는 상업지역과 유희에 광역 혜택을 주는 건물이 있는데, 이것을 인간은 몰아서 지어서 후반부 생산력과 쾌적도가 대폭발하지만 AI는 이걸 잘 활용하지 못한다. 

한편, 외교에 깊이를 추가하기 위해 추가되었다는 아젠다는 오히려 외교의 재미를 없애는 요소가 되었다. 아젠다는 각 국가별로 선호하는 행동과 싫어하는 행동이 정해져서, 그것이 서로의 관계에 영향을 준다는 시스템이다. 

각 국가별로 1개는 완전히 고정되어있고, 1개는 랜덤으로 정해지는데, 고정 아젠다 때문에 언제나 비슷한 양상으로 게임이 돌아간다. 예를 들어, 미국은 자기 대륙에서 싸우는 문명을 싫어하는데, 영국은 자기 대륙의 다른 문명을 박살내는 문명을 좋아한다. 이러다보니 미국과 영국이 플레이어와 같은 대륙에 있고, 플레이어가 전쟁을 계속하고 있다면 미국은 언제나 나를 싫어하고, 영국은 매우 좋아한다. 뭐 전작에도 비슷한 식으로 알렉산더가 맨날 사기 치고 등에 칼박는 일이 흔했지만, 이정도는 아니었다고 본다(알렉산더도 가끔은 믿을 수 있었다고...)

게다가 외교에 다양한 선전포고 이유를 대고 전쟁광 페널티를 없애는 시스템이 추가된 것은 좋지만, 전쟁 사주 등 이 사라지고, AI끼리도 서로 사이가 안 좋아서 연합 러시를 하는 일도 없고... 여러모로 AI의 완성도는 아쉬운 수준을 떠나 실망스럽다. 

마지막으로, UI는 예쁘게는 바뀌었지만, 정작 필요한 아이콘이나 메뉴가 없는 일이 많다. 전체 유닛의 리스트는 유닛 이름을 눌러야 나오질 않나, 전쟁피로도는 도대체 어떻게 된건지 이해할 수가 없다거나....

총평:

문명 시리즈는 점점 더 현실에 근접하는 게임 시스템을 만들어나가다가, 5편부터 '게임'으로의 완성도를 더 추구하는 쪽으로 변화되었다. 6편은 5편보다 좀 '시뮬레이션'보다는 '게임'에 가깝게 바뀌는 시도를 했지만, 그것이 성공적인가는 플레이어 개인의 취향에 따라 다를 수 있다고 본다. 리뷰에선 이런 저런 단점을 적긴 했지만 그래도 어쩌겠는가, 나는 또 밤을 새는데.

65659258.review:
Я играю в Цивилизацию с 1991 года - как только она вышла, она сразу же завладела мной. И по сей день эта серия игр является чем-то, во что приятно вернуться и отдохнуть.
Вторая цивилизация - была большим шагом в пошаговых стратегиях - тактики, стратегии, да и графика по сравнению с первой частью сделала большой шаг вперёд.
Третья цивилизация - стала для моей жены второй пошаговой стратегией после Героев Магии и Меча, в которую ей понравилось играть. Более того - появилась возможность играть вместе и это было круто! Начиная с третьей части - это стало нашей некоей семейной традицией - поиграть вечером пару десятков ходов. 
Четвертая цивилизация - стала логическим продолжением третьей, привнеся новые идеи развития и новую графику.
И наконец - пятая. И в неё мы играем по сей день. По мне - так эталон, пусть и не лишённый каких-то минусов.

И вот вышла Цивилизация 6... Уже на этапе предварительных обзоров в игру... как-то не сильно хотелось играть. Смущала мультяшная графика, какие-то непонятные (на тот момент) районы, внезапно трех-разовые рабочие и много чего было не понятно... Игру вроде и ждал, а вроде и нет. И вот она вышла. Ценник был не особо гуманным, но купить мог... Но вал отрицательных отзывов о багах заставил подождать. Потом внезапно выяснилось что разработчик фактически продаёт игру по кускам: отельные расы, крупные игровые механики, как DLC - всё стоит денег. И не маленьких. И всё это не вызывало желания покупать игру до каких-то крупных скидок. И вот крупная скидка. Купил и себе и жене всю игру со всеми дополнениями. И что же я получил?
Игра новая. Много новых игровых механик. К графике можно привыкнуть. Казалось бы - играй себе... И я честно отыграл одну кампанию на огромной карте до научной победы. И игра скорее не понравилась, чем понравилась... Что не так...
1) Игра красива - да. Но красота требует жертв. Игра требует значительно больше ресурсов от системы, по сравнению с 5 частью. Причём удивляет что ресурсы жрёт эта самая мультяшность, а не скажем, сверхреализм.
2) Ходы АИ идут достаточно долго, чтобы это могло надоесть. И это в мирное время. Игра просто тянет время. Не тормозит. Именно тянет.
3) "Огромная карта" - по ощущению - значительно меньше "огромной карты" в 5 части игры. От чего соседи находят тебя слишком быстро, а тебе приходится срочно "отжимать территорию", вместо стройного развития.
4) Рабочие. Они теперь скорее мешают. Рабочий сделал 3 улучшения и пропал... В случае с Китаем - 4. И если у вас и так проблемы с производством, вы начинаете судорожно выбирать: строить город или рабочих. А рабочими ещё и придётся управлять руками - да-да: никаких больше автоматических улучшений. Вы будете шарить по карте государства и искать где-что строить/чинить/улучшать. Толпы рабочих = адский и не нужный микро-менеджмент...
5) Идея районов - пожалуй хороша. Она исключает такие парадоксы, когда в море есть остров на 1 клетку, на нем стоит город, в котором 100500 строений и столько же чудес света. Но в какой-то момент тоже начинает надоедать: реально каждому городу для жизни требуется один и тот же набор районов, а дополнительные - приходится держать в голове: где-что есть. Да и с контрразведкой - это теперь геморрой: деньги воруют из коммерческого района, науку из научного итд. И шпионов приходится ставить с каждый район, а не город, как в 5 части. А их тут тоже ограниченное количество...  
6) Отдельные "лучи добра" хочется послать тем, кто разработал интерфейс. Отчёты - неудобны и не информативны. Нужные влияния-культуры-религии утоплены в иконки-линзы, а не выведены в отдельные кнопки. Отдельное "спасибо" за миссионеров. Я слил основанную мной религию, так как ждал их появления в общем списке производства города. Уже в конце игры, я случайно обнаружил, что они давным-давно у меня были, но покупались за религию в отдельном меню...
7) Великие люди. Это отдельный аттракцион. Их в игре ограниченное количество, каждого типа. И два великих инженера или, скажем, пророка - делают не одно и то же. Один инженер даёт +1500 производства в космической гонке, второй - построит лишь фабрику. На великих людей можно накопить золотом, верой или очками. Но пока будете копить на то что нравится, то что нужно купят. Так в начале вы запросто можете остаться без собственной веры - просто не успеете вырвать одного из 7 пророков у других цивилизаций или построить Стоунхедж. Здорово ли это? По мне - это лишнее усложнение.
8.) Губернаторы. Если родили разных Великих людей, то тогда и Губернаторов могли бы каждой цивилизации тоже сделать разных. Хотя бы с разными деревьями скиллов. 
9) Влияние на города-государства. Вот тут: явный плюс. Всё решает не золото а количество послов. Это действительно интересно! Да и вызывает желание выполнять задания городов: ведь каждое выполненное даст вам + 1 посла в городе. А это, в конечном счёте даёт очки влияния для всяких конгрессов, что в свою очередь может привести к дипломатической победе. Может, но приведёт ли - вопрос, так как тут она представлена достаточно мутно...
10) АИ правителей других государств откровенно туп. Неадекватные требования, смены настроения, отказы в союзах-дружбах. В частности, Китай, половину игры был от меня далеко, мы с ним не пересекались и не конкурировали, но дружить он со мной не хотел. Объяснялось это "неизвестными причинами" в количестве 4 штук. А потом внезапно он подобрел - мир, дружба жвачка. "Я не могу принять ваше предложение о союзе!". Но если вы дадите 1 золотой сверху (не за ход, а просто), то ура - союз... "Я обещаю больше за Вами не шпионить" - говорит вам ваш союзник. Через несколько ходов вы ловите его шпиона. И ничего не можете сделать - даже осудить. Бред.
11) Претензии для ведения войн. Полная и тотальная бредятина. Не нужный абсолютно костыль. Причём ещё и вредный в случае с игрой против АИ, который свою тупость компенсирует штамповкой юнитов, явно не имея на это ресурсов. Пока вы пыжитесь с осуждениями-претензиями, ваш противник лепит войска. А точнее - просто их рисует. Даже варвары. Не видели раньше варваров на современных танках? В 6 цивилизации - увидите. 
12) Совсем забыл! Дороги. Дороги рабочие больше не строят. Да-да. Внезапно их строят торговцы. И не так  как Вам нравится, а так как будет проложен торговый маршрут: пока он прётся к точке назначения, он каждый ход протаптывает дорогу... Хотите дороги между своими городами? Теряйте время на торговые маршруты внутри страны. Ну или ждите угля и паровозов. Железные дороги строит военный инженер. Не автоматически... руками... одна клетка-одно действие ценой в 1 уголь. Чрезвычайно "увлекательно".
13) Всякие катаклизмы - тоже вот по мне: условности. Вулкан не появляется из ниоткуда. И только желающий участи Помпеи будет строить город рядом с вулканом. Наводнения? Не лепи город в пойме или строй дамбу. Поднимается уровень океана? Морские дамбы. Торнадо-бури? Смирись - тебе же нравится строить рабочих, а потом таскать их по карте руками и чинить разрушения?
14) Это лично моё мнение, но мне откровенно не приятно, что 95% цитат, при открытии новых технологий - цитаты великих и могучих американцев. Причём, в основном известных только им самим. Даже если нечего сказать по теме, то пихают просто что-то, но их. Это как-то ломает кайф и не вызывает желания читать это всё.
15) Вообще обилие вот этого не нужного ручного управления как-то сократило динамику игры. Игра тянется и её хочется скорее закончить любой ценой. Это не доставляет удовольствия.

Можно ещё много чего перечислять... 
Игру нельзя назвать провальной - нет. Она вполне себе удалась. Более того, тем кто не играл в 1-5 части игры, она может зайти, ибо на новенького... Я же, видимо, вернусь обратно в 5 часть. Она не напрягает, не тянет время и в ней есть всё что нужно. 

Я ставлю положительный отзыв на игру, лишь в дань почти полным 29 годам, проведённым в играх этого разработчика. И в надежде, что когда-нибудь выйдет 7 часть, которая вернёт веру в "светлое и высокое". Но, откровенно говоря - не верю.

56454903.review:
When I first played Sid Meier's Civ 1, I played to exhaustion, watching a friend's apartment, fell asleep on the floor for a few hours, and played again, until he and his wife came home.  He let me keep the game.  After a week, I settled down to a few hours per day, back when my disabilities made employment harder to find.  That game, and Civ 2, 3, and 4, helped keep me going.

With Civ 5, another friend talked me out of the kiddie pool of lower difficulty settings, and I discovered how much fun each of the 40-some sides could be.  The same friend gifted me Civ 6, for last Christmas, and I liked it so much, I gifted the $80 every-DLC-as-it-comes-out edition to another friend.  I put about 15,000 hours into Civ 5, and have already put over 4,000 hours into Civ 6.  

My first impression was as bewildered as had been my first encounter with Civ 5.  Gorgeous as Civ 6 is, my main thought was channeling UPS: "What can brown do for you?"  But eventually I figured out how to assign envoys.  Now I can even interpret the graphics for developed hexes in others' empires' sepia tones.

Occasionally, the map gets stuck scrolling, and I have to save, exit, and restart the game.  But I go weeks without that happening.  I haven't run into any other annoying factors.

So far, I've played Pericles' culture-focused Greece, Russia for a religion win, China for wonder-spamming and science,  Tomyris' unstoppable Scythians, and my favorite so far, the peaceful Canadians.  Each one has been full of unique fun.  I hope you enjoy this game.  There are lots of good video play-throughs on YouTube and Twitch, of course.  Watch before you buy, and you'll know what to expect.  I think most people will find at least a few sides that they enjoy completely.

43842329.review:
After putting in about 1500 hours at the time of writing this, I think it's safe to say I can write a somehwat informed review (because I have opinions and I like to share them, that's why). I'm no veteran Civ player, I've only played 5 and 6, though I'm aware that 3 and 4 are still good games. However, even coming from 5 which had it's own disappointing launch, 6 is a massive drop in depth and quality. No matter how hard I try, I cannot lose myself in this game the way I did in 5. I'm never on edge, wondering what will happen next, because I know what'll happen next. War. War for settling wrong. War for being the wrong religion. War for governing wrong. War for being too strong and too week (at the same time). War for not trading. War for simply existing in a manner that doesn't quite suit somebody else. What seems to be an attempt to inject some personality to diplomacy with "agendas", results in predictable games where everyone hates you, or everyone loves you (until they don't). There's never a middle ground.

On agendas, certain civs simply don't play themselves as they should. Hey Brazil, I see you've denounced literally everyone on Earth for making more great people than you. Would you like to change that? Maybe build a campus or theater square? No? Just gonna build another encampment? Thought so. Nice to meet you China. No I didn't realize you were the preemminent builder of wonders in the world. Do you know why? It's because you never built one China, that's why. Ah, Cleopatra, I see you're now chronically indecisive, as you simultaneously hate and love large militaries, and simply can't make your mind up. These agendas will override everything else you do with/to another civ. If you are friends with America and watch helpless as the Aztecs burn and pillage their way across the continent, you might be inclined to pitch in on good ol' America's behalf. But more fool you, because you see, America hates people who declare war on his neighbours, even if those neighbours are currently enslaving his own people and turning his cities to ash. A man's got to have a code after all. Now you're a warmonger. Why? Good question, but it's ok, Alexander the Great still loves you.

The next part of my rant jamboree is the design of the game, such as unit scaling and modelling and such. Before the game was launched there were many people who expressed concern over a "mobile game" aesthetic, justly concerned that 2K might be trying to grant their next installment with some more mass appeal at the expense of anyone being able to take this seriously. Thankfully, the gameplay hasn't been dumbed down, so much as screwed up (see agendas). I am not terrified of this army of strangely proportioned stretch armstrong figures marching towards me, because I'm too distracted by the trader, whose cart is 2 or 3 times taller than my palace. In Civ 5, when the Mongol horde was at my borders, it stretched on and on like, well, a horde. Now it appears to be maybe 20 horses all together, each being roughly the size of an entire building, and altogether looking rather silly. If course there's another reason not to be intimidated by the Mongol horde, or anyone else's horde for that matter. The entire combined forces of all other AI civs could be beaten back with a damp rag and a can do attitude.

The AI in Civ 6 cannot war, which is particularly damning in a game that always ends in a war. Alexander the Great of Macedon may command the most fearsome force known to man, but rest assured, it'll be soundly defeated by simply doing the following; ranged units + garrion promotion, place in city centres and encampments. Or just wait them out, when you think the enemy has gained the advantage they'll just sit there and contemplate life, or throw themselves away on fortified units with ranged support. It's worth pointing out that at launch the AI did not even know how to use boats or planes, so I wouldn't hold your breath or anyone elses for any of this to change any time soon.

I will now try to think of some nice things to say about Civ 6. You can use mods in multiplayer games fairly easily. See that overpowered civ from your favorite TV show that was obviously made by a fan with no thought to game balance? Yup, you can bring that into a game with your friends and make them regret basking in your presence. The most fun I've managed to have in this game has been with friends, where the only real competition in science, culture, faith and of course, war, are the other human players. The AI might aswell be so many other city states. Oh and the music. While I miss wartime music (listening to the cheerful Kongo theme while nuclear hellfire engulfs the planet is a bit jarring) the whole idea of music evolving with eras is just fantastic. Entering the industrial era to "Scotland the Brave" blaring in your ears while you agressively bagpipe the inferior nations of the world into submission is satisfying, to say the least. But then you realize that you're building the same cities all over the map, and that the last game you tried to get into was the same as this one, and that enemy you've been contending with isn't really contending so much as falling behind because he decided to give up on winning. And then everyone denounces you for being close to winning yourself. And then I get tired of this and try and get Civ 5 to work again with a bagillion mods.

(oh yeah and districts aren't that special, I always end up building the same 2 or 3 different cities with no variation)

(I'll stop typing now I am very tired)

EDIT:

I have so many hours played in this game because of friends who used to enjoy playing it. As they lost interest, I lost interest. There were other mods I used that also made it fun, which are no longer usable since the summer patch (I think, it might have been the spring one I can't remember). I cannot reccomend this game because it does not stand up on it's own as a civ game should. Time and time again the modding community has found and fixed bugs that should have been dealt with before release. Maybe the next big dlc will make Civ6 a game worthy of the franchise, I don't know. Until such a time I do not think anyone should buy this game. That is my opinion and I am entitled to it no matter how many hours I have played, or whether or not I "got my money's worth".

(While I understand where some people are coming from with the "you played a bunch but didn't like it so why did you play it" mentality, I would not take any review seriously with few hours played, regardless of wether they reccomended it or not. If my friends came with the game in a sort of package deal, then sure I'd reccomend it, but I got them elsewhere)

GS EDIT:

Another DLC, and with it some more game mechanics for the AI to struggle with. There's really not much more to it than that. Obvious one is climate change and disasters, of which there is very little change and it's not very disastrous. Just keep a builder or two on stand by if you're in a disaster prone area and you'll be fine. Of the couple times I've had the patience to see a game to completion, not once did the sea level rise, which leads me to believe that you have to really go out of your way to screw up the planet. The main incentive for burning fossil fuels seems to be powering tier 3 buildings in certain districts. Not only is this not necessary, as these buildings still provide their standard yield, but you can just hold out for cleaner energy sources a couple more techs down the line.

The other "new" mechanic is the world congress (for some reason starting in the year 500 AD), which at the very least is a more nostalgic kind of stupid. Fans of Civ 5 can look back on fond memories of the great nations of the world banding together against the true enemy of civilization, truffles. Voting yourself is pointless (unless you're playing Sweden), because the AI will mass vote to ban random things regardless of whether it hurts them or not.

47393681.review:
Я фанат Civilization. 
Начал играть в серию ещё в далёком 1996 году с самой первой части. Возможно даже эта игра привила мне любовь к истории (закончил факультет истории и политологии с красным дипломом). Играл во все части на PC, за исключением Beyond Earth  (сеттинг не нравится). 

Я молча хавал все нововведения, которые далеко не всегда приходились по душе, молча хавал когда разрешили заходить только одним юнитом на клетку (до сих пор не уверен на 100 %, что это было верным решением). Молча хавал, когда убрали возможность культурной и религиозной ассимиляции (которая была интересно реализована вроде бы в третьей части игры). Разработчики в поиске, их тоже можно понять. Я молча хавал и то, что игра чаще всего на старте выходила голой, отличавшейся от предыдущих частей лишь обновлённой графикой и некоторыми, незначительными, элементами геймплея.
А всё потому, что игра с каждым новым DLC игра становилась лучше, это однозначно. Становилась современнее, не изменяя своим корням. 

Но вот, впервые, я ставлю этой игре отрицательную оценку. А всё почему? Ответ, как и многих. Из-за платных DLC. 

После выхода VI части, я купил Делюкс версию, думая, что как и раньше, с покупкой данного издания получу все будущие DLC бесплатно и избавлю себя от лишних хлопот. 
Но нет, тут неожиданно выходит  Rise and Fall и, к моему удивлению, оказывается платной. Несмотря на то, что у меня Делюкс издание, которое ранее избавляло от возни в виде покупок DLC, что я ненавижу. 

Но я опять схавал! Схавал и не стал писать негативный отзыв. Просто удалил игру. Подумая, что может и вернусь в неё со временем.

А сейчас, выходит ещё и Gathering Storm. Которая должна принести в игру то, что они ДОЛЖНЫ были сделать на старте, если они хотят развития серии. И это DLC стоит почти как Deluxe издание. У меня нет слов.

А проблема далеко не в деньгах. Я готов купить хорошую игру за немалые деньги, сразу, со всеми DLC либо с возможностью получить их потом, с возможностью обновления. Но я не хочу чтобы меня грабили. Не хочу каждый раз платить за DLC, улучшающий игру (что они должны делать и так, с выходом каждой новой части, ведь это развитие), как за полную игру. А цива славилась тем, что ты мог на старте купить делюкс за высокую цену, и потом просто докачивать новые DLC, не покупая их. 

Именно поэтому ставлю жирнейший минус. Может когда-нибудь я и куплю эти DLC, по большой скидке. Но если и не куплю, то не расстроюсь. Ещё одна любимая серия идёт ко дну.

26354853.review:
你一定可以完成神級征服勝利。

不要用什麼羅馬一回合分數勝利那種無聊玩意，你玩的是文明帝國，史上最偉大的遊戲。
你也不必賣兵賺錢；被你打得狼奔豕突的鄰居自然會給你源源不絕的軍費。
專注於征服，避免損失任何兵力，直撲鄰居首都；斬首後在外交上獅子大開口，徹底廢掉一個勢力後奔向下一個鄰居。
到了第五、六個敵人會比較辛苦，但不要被對方先進一個時代的單位嚇到了；電腦文明看不懂這篇評論，也不敢對你全面開戰。用剝洋蔥的方式敲開敵人的防守，把敵人的城市當成自己的前線基地，穩穩地邁向神級難度下最簡單的挑戰：征服勝利。

以下介紹背景、設定、概念與操作細節建議。
遊戲經驗：玩過一、三、四、五，但向來都選酋長級難度；通常當成模擬城市玩。開始挑戰神級前，打了一次開拓者難度征服勝利，以了解新的城市機制與戰鬥規則。
遊戲設定：天神級小地圖，六國並列，隨機文明抽到羅馬。
憑什麼贏：弓兵， 電腦文明外交無腦。
你不需要/不可以：修改，賣兵，蓋奇觀，追著尤里卡跑。

征服概念：
1. 戰鬥中不可損失單位。
一支兵都不可以死。在近代以前，這些兵不會因為打不過別人而死，卻會因為統帥－就是你－錯誤的布局而死。到處都有樹林、山丘，利用地形增加防禦力，觀察遠程部隊與地形的關係，部隊一旦黃血就後退由後面的單位補上。

2. 撐過去就是你的。
羅馬 3520BC 遭遇西班牙兩支棍棒兵突襲首都。自己的棍棒兵與投石兵都在外面探索，手上的現金只夠買一支斥候；根本羅貫中空城計。當時心想：「哇神級就是不一樣，已經要滅國了耶。」豈料西班牙人打沒兩下，一損血就跑了；等到他們回頭時外派兵力已經回防，還生了新兵參戰。AI 好笨的，他們不懂佈陣圍攻，只會陸續送死。用精確的走位搭配地形耗光來襲部隊，然後就可以進行下一步。

3. 立刻反擊
為什麼不能損失任何單位？因為防禦戰之後就是進攻戰。清光來犯敵軍就要倒打回去，找到敵方城市，尋找有利地形進攻；用弓兵系的遠程部隊攻城，兩格距離足以攻擊城市卻不被城內部隊攻擊。同時要有兩支盡量保持滿血的步兵，他們可以當肉盾格在城市與我方遠程之間，等城市防禦耗盡就可以衝入城中佔領。

4. 以戰逼和
第一座城市即將陷落時，可能就有人來求和啦。且慢，給什麼都不要理他。為什麼？因為這是征服勝利啊，征服勝利就是要斬首，求和條件不會包含首都，當然等打下首都了再來談和平。而且和平只有一個條件：所有現金與最高額分期付款，還有新首都之外的所有城市；不斷反覆洗掉條件重新要求，如果怎麼要求都不同意，就繼續打；他會同意的。
有一個情況是對方還沒遷都，就給你所有錢、資源與除了首都之外的所有城市。答應的好處是這樣就廢了一個國家，之後還可以用奢侈品跟他騙錢，因為有原始首都的電腦文明有額外金錢加給，每回合五十、一百都有。記得要確保這個國家無法再殖民蓋新城。

5. 征伐不止
隨時尋找向下一個國家開戰的機會；發現此刻的目標已經沒有部隊可以反擊，坐以待斃之時，就要考慮下一個目標；原則上首都離目前部隊集結處越近的越好。是說除了打仗之外，應該還記得要不斷探索世界吧？

6. 移民堡壘
覺得敵國好像太遠，周圍也沒有什麼好地形？不要客氣，派個移民過去貼著邊境蓋城，立刻就是一座進攻基地；如果對方生氣指責甚至宣戰就更好了。

雖然人工智慧已經可以駕馭圍棋，但文明帝國的 AI 不但愚笨而且懦弱；他們沒有戰術，不會利用地形，不懂局部優勢，更不懂外交談判。你不需要修改，不必賣兵，合理砍樹，拒絕奇觀與尤里卡的誘惑，你一定可以完成神級征服勝利。

------
你問這款遊戲值不值得買？一代奠定了文明帝國的遊戲概念，三代奠定了文化圈概念，四代加入了文明支柱之一的宗教力量，五代啟用六角格與禁止堆疊部隊大幅提高戰術樂趣，六代則建立了科技與文化雙聖樹制度。雖然還有 bug 待修（為什麼熱氣球移動會受到地形限制？敵方未完成軍事基地好像會用我的部隊打我耶？）雖然肯定需要資料片加強一些細節，但每一代文明帝國，都會成為當之無愧的偉大經典。

不過再怎麼經典，它都會特價打折。如果你已經有 423 款遊戲了，或許就不必這麼急著買吧。
