63532397.review:
秦始皇帝者，秦庄襄王子也。庄襄王为秦质子於赵，见吕不韦姬，悦而取之，生始皇。以秦昭王四十八年正月生於邯郸。及生，名为政，姓赵氏。年十三岁，庄襄王死，政代立为秦王。
  当是之时，秦地已并巴、蜀、汉中，越宛有郢，置南郡矣；北收上郡以东，有河东、太原、上党郡；东至荥阳，灭二周，置三川郡。
  吕不韦为相，封十万户，号曰文信侯。招致宾客游士，欲以并天下。李斯为舍人。蒙骜、王齮、麃公等为将军。王年少，初即位，委国事大臣。
                                                                                                                                                                 ——《史记⦁秦始皇本纪》

44814257.review: 别的游戏氪金，这个游戏氪命

43876362.review:
想起来steam忘评价了，就顺手把tap上的转过来了

关于我自己，算是个文明系列老玩家了？从文明3开始的所有文明（包括BE和4COL）全玩过、研究过、背过百科。情怀玩家，6代买的实体周年纪念版，本体带运税100+刀。做过战报，做过新手教程，编辑过百科，翻译过更新，做过视频，做过直播，现在正在搞着大型MOD，在此恳请某些可能会出现的“真爱粉”嘴下积点德，理解一下这样一个爱着这款游戏但是恨铁不成钢的老玩家，谢谢。

事先声明，这篇评测针对的是将文明系列当4X策略游戏的玩家，如果你是想要体验模拟城市的玩家（6代建模的确挺精细的）或是怎么玩都无所谓的娱乐玩家请忽视这篇评测。

先说优点：

新颖的格子设计（城区，奇观，城墙）+1

城区系统的设计的确还是值得肯定的，通过规划奇观、城区的位置可以获取更高产出，这加强了游戏的策略性（不过实际上真正的布局狂魔也只有土澳德国日本吧），同时也加强了骚扰战术（到家里偷个建筑就跑）的可行性，丰富了战斗策略（虽然AI傻的要命根本不会骚扰）。

城墙这个设计个人感觉比5代真实不少（其实4代城墙也很赞，不过战斗机制大改导致那个设计不能用了），6代的城墙真正意义上像一个保护城市的外围设施了，同时也把5代和废物一样的城墙的地位提升了不少，算是一个兼顾真实性和游戏性的不错设计吧。

回归的前作优点+0.5

6代加回了5代删掉的一些4代饱受好评的系统，比如政体。6代的政体更像是34代的结合品：3代的政体选择和4代的政策切换。这个系统的初衷是好的：增多可选项提高策略性，增强每个文明的特异性，同时多个选项可以应对多种处境，增大游戏的变数以增强耐玩性。

以及加回了类似4代健康的住房系统（作用同为限制人口上限，同样是人口超过规定值后会降低增长速度）等等，就不一一举例了。

之所以只加0.5是其也因为删掉了前作不少精髓的地方，比如世界议会，5代的文化树（与其叫政策不如叫文化传承更符合这个系统的设计初衷，顺便删掉这个直接导致6代科技树人文树同质化）等等。个人感觉潮起的外交和国际商路系统也算一大亮点，可能是因为是dead game制作组不敢借鉴吧。

音乐方面不太懂，就不敢随便打分了，不过个人很喜欢文明6的BGM（说的不是你，克里），总之是可以算进优点的。

然后就是缺点了（话说有的时候真的希望F社多听听中国玩家的意见，总在CFC听某个云菜鸡吹B有什么意思啊，明明国人无论图透极限还是随机nosl回合数都比cfc那帮老外高）：

过于崩坏的数值系统-2

只扣两分我都算对得起F社了，6代的数值体系崩坏不是一句两句能说的完的，先分段说一下，等以后想到再补充。

首先是产出和消耗，文明系列经典的产出消耗模型是双指数增长，也就是说只要你城市的工业产值与时代齐平，都不会出现造一个建筑或者单位要二三十回合的情况。到文明6，产出被改为线性增长，而消耗变为指数增长……举个最直观的例子，可能你前期所有正常发育的城市都能做到6回合左右一个骑手，但是到游戏大后期，除了某个用商路堆出来的特大城市之外，你的其他城市需要20回合左右的时间来造一辆坦克。这样的数值模型导致游戏越后期的建筑、单位越难造出来，也导致了越后期出现的建筑性价比越低。举个例子：大学造价250产4瓶，实验室造价580产5瓶，其中大学还可以吃到牛顿的+2和爱因斯坦的+4；再举个例子，工坊造价195锤每回合产2锤……这种明显给人感觉建模崩坏的数值在游戏里还有很多，就不一一举例了。

关于单位有人可能会说：单位是必需品，你不造高级兵AI就造兵打死你，这就又涉及到另一个数值崩坏了。文明系列历来有一个系统，将低级兵种变成同兵科高级兵种，我们通常叫这个操作升级，而这个操作一直花费的都是金币。文明34由于金币决定科研，价值体系与56差异大很多暂且不表（实际上就个人游戏体验来说，4代升兵代价更大），就单说56代升级的价值体系：

5代官方模型金锤1：1的情况下，升级费为2倍产能差+10，基本可以粗略的认定为升级的金币利用效率是50%（不过由于金币并不能有转换为锤子的通畅渠道，所以实际1金币价值远低于1锤子，这里先用官方模型计算一下），而5代的金币除了转换为锤子外，还有其它转换为价值的渠道，比如买宣，比如买城邦……然而哪怕在如此大的限制条件下，科技一到升兵开打依旧是文明5的主流。

有了5代的前车之鉴，F社在设计6代金币体系的时候是这么设计的：金锤比2：1，升级费为1.5倍产能差+10。升级的金币利用效率为133.3%

……

……

……

F社你在逗我？不过最可气的还不是这个，F社嫌金币作用不够强，于是在中世纪加入了一张政策卡：升级单位费用减半，这样就可以达到266.7%的金币利用率啦（哪怕把造兵政策卡和法西斯都算上，升级单位也是极其高效的做法）～

……

……

……

我先平复一下心情。

到尤其是新版加入了：在没军营的城市高级兵种战略资源不足2的话可以锤低级兵种这条设定（有1战略资源就可以升级），在这个金币的产出和价值均高于锤子的模型下，基本就是谁锤高级兵谁傻子，那么这个傻子会是谁呢？当然是AI啦！由于AI不懂得造低级兵升级，导致其大量产能都浪费在了锤高级兵上而疏于发展，从而造成了玩家和AI之间的巨大鸿沟。我甚至怀疑F社在向我们灌输紫本主义好的理念(●—●)

其次是诟病了很久的涨价系统。文明6中的区域是随着时间涨价的，初始54，随着科技的发展最高可以涨到540，为了避免玩家后期锤不起区域，F社决定让砍树获得的锤子一起水涨船高，从20最高到200（用的是同一个系数）。可是建筑价格不会涨啊喂！更何况文明6有一个“拍地基”操作，就是选定区域的建筑位置后，这个区域会被认定为建造中而不会继续涨价。之前我提到过，由于不合理的产出消耗模型导致中后期很难锤出建筑。那么锤不出来怎么办呢？砍树啊！新城大学锤不出来？砍树啊！考古学家太贵？砍树啊！没工人砍树了？砍树出工人啊！没树砍了？这城废了。文明6在原版时代就已经被人戏称为“砍树6”，城市所到之处，寸草不留。从真实性来说：你见过哪个文明发家致富是靠从远古砍树砍到信息的？还是见过谁家宇航飞船是砍树用木头拼的？从游戏性上来说：文明已经脱离了4X中的exploit了，而是变成了一款到处寻求一次性能源（树）以建造一些产出固定产出的东西（有建筑的城市）的圈地游戏了。尤其身为文明的核心资源：科技（文明6科技和文化都很重要），在文明6中不再与城市状态挂钩（4代要养村5代要养人口，6代你图书馆大学造出来基本就不用管了），导致文明6现在的玩法基本限定于圈地砍树，然后把城市晾在那不管就完了。

那么，为了应对这样游戏性崩坏的状况，F社在资料片中是如何应对的呢？他们在新资料骗中增加了一个能让砍树产出+100%（春更已削至50%）的城市总督。

……

……

……

然后说说游戏兵种的数值，在同等造价维护费的情况下，骑士4移动48战斗力，无视ZOC，解锁科技是中路关键路线上的；长矛2移动41战斗力，对骑兵+10战斗力，解锁科技是个没有其它任何用的断头（没有后续的）科技。如果你对文明6的包夹支援机制有一点了解，你就会明白这3点战斗力在+2速无视ZOC面前有多无力了，这里不赘述了。更关键的，这还是加强过的长矛，以前的长矛造价将近骑士的两倍。哦顺便再说一下，身为中世纪单位的长矛，由于兵种克制的关系，打不过古典时期的主力近战单位剑士，其中剑士造价比长矛低一半。剩下的有关反骑兵单位战斗力模型的长篇大论CFC上面有人发了，感兴趣的可以看看，我就不再赘述了。

还有0扩张惩罚。之前我提到过，游戏后期建筑性价比极低的情况（比如实验室和大学），可能会有经验老道的4X玩家会说：因为边际效应之类的，后期实验室造价高很正常，毕竟一座城不能造两个大学，但可以造一个大学一个实验室以提升极限科研产出。但很可惜，这套理论在文明6行不通，因为我可以再造一座新城。之前我提到过，45由于科研产出和城市状态挂钩，所以铺下的新城是没有什么科研产出的，甚至由于4代的城市维护费和5代的获得城市增加科研阈值，建立新城反而会在短时间内拉低科研产出。但是在文明6，你完全不用担心，因为建立新城市根本没有惩罚，你只需要付出移民的成本，你就可以获得一座和建立了几千年的大城一样科研产出的城市啦～那么学院（科技建筑所在区域）图书馆大学哪来的呢？砍树啊！这个操作被我们成为“铺鬼城”，就是把新城铺到一切有树（甚至可能是冻土中间），通过砍树使得这座城市产出我们想要的产出，然后就放在那里不管死活就好啦～这种0惩罚铺城（还有砍树的高性价比），更加剧了高级建筑无用化，同时大幅度缩短了游戏时间，降低了游戏难度，资料片版本神标（神级标准地图标准速度）最快的科技胜利记录是117回合（116回合公元元年），而其它胜利的极限甚至压进了100T。

还有溢出锤系统，这是一个只有玩家会用的，但是能把砍树收益放大到1.5倍以上的操作。虽然5代也有溢出锤，但由于没有6代这么恐怖砍树收益，所以只作为一个小技巧（相对6代算小了）出现，而到了6代，由于巨量的砍树收益，导致整局下来，溢出锤的产出甚至可能会高于城市自产锤子。溢出锤的具体操作就是在建造那些有建造速度加成的单位/建筑时砍树，由于有速度加成，砍树所得的锤子会乘上倍数（通常是1.5），在建造完当前的项目后，这些乘过倍数的砍树锤会留给下一个建造项目，无论下个项目有没有建造速度加成。由于大部分建筑都没有建造速度加成，玩家可以利用溢出锤放大本来就很巨大的砍树收益，从而用更少的树完成那些没有建造速度加成的项目。

剩下的数值崩坏想到再说。

莫名其妙的外交系统-1

为什么明明议程系统是借鉴的文明太空，可是在文明6却被喷的狗血喷头呢？因为议程对外交占的影响太大了，在文明6，地缘政治就是玩笑话，玩起来反倒有种galgame的感觉：这些女孩喜欢这些讨厌这些，干了这些加好感干了这些减好感……完全体现不出来文明外交的感觉：哪怕你一个兵都没有，隔壁阿兹特克大军压境，只要你卖他几个他没有奢侈品，马上宣布友好而撤军。少了外交的尔虞我诈，文明6的外交给人一种扮家家酒的感觉。而由于宣布友好不能背刺和过于重要的议程系统，想要和平种田的玩家不再需要什么外交手段，只需要满足各个领袖德喜好就好。弱国无外交？抱歉我没兵不光有外交，还能全世界友好（埃及除外）_(:з」∠)_同时，由于外交系统能提供的东西减少（相对前代），再加上6代AI军事力量普遍偏弱，哪怕是被全世界谴责的战狂，也可以照样毫无阻力的推平全世界，甚至可以在神标盘古在见面宣战的情况下毫无压力的击败7家AI联盟。

过多的BUG和过慢的修复-1

先讲个笑话。英国的技能是在外大陆建立一座城市获得一个近战单位，但是玩家们发现占领一座城市也可以获得一个近战单位。就当中文翻译怀疑人生以为自己翻译错了，并把翻译改为了在外大陆获得城市时获得一个近战单位后，F社在游戏发布了一年半后宣布：这是一个BUG，我们将在下次更新修复。

剩下的还有基卢瓦双倍加成，祠堂只加单城，翼骑兵戳不死人，克里UA可以利用敌人的牧场，刚果UA无效，刚产出的巨作可以掏空AI……感兴趣的话去贴吧或者在线百科看看就行了，我实在不想一一举例了，反正翼骑兵BUG从波兰出来到现在都没修过。

更新的迟缓与资料片诚意-0.5

半年没出新DLC，3个月不更新，甚至F社最近还要开新IP。

甚至最近的redshell事件我都不忍心扣分了，文明6和前作比起来真的是太让人失望了，文明45太空的完全体（全资料片DLC）都是不错的游戏，如果有想体验文明系列的同学，暂时不推荐文明6（私心推荐一下文明太空：潮起，除了既没有文明的历史代入感也没有太空的代入感外，算是一个不错的好游戏）。

44682782.review: 电脑启动！！steam启动！！文明6启动！！下辈子见

59696009.review: I'm positive nobody's going to read this, but Civ 6 is a good game. It had a rocky start, but the devs managed to iron out all the kinks and now it's a fine addition to the series. A lot of people prefer Civ 5, but while that was also an amazing game, I prefer to play 6. It doesn't let you cheat the movement system as much, and it keeps things more interesting throughout the game than Civ 5 did. The AIs are more aggressive, which makes them more interesting to play against. Probably the only pitfall to Civ 6 is the Rise and Fall expansion. It's a shame you can't play Gathering Storm (a much better expansion IMO) without it.

36314368.review: 文明这个游戏，无论如何都不要买首发，等两年把bug改完了，DLC出齐了再买不迟

38421130.review:
I love this game, but would I buy it full price? No...

I have been playing Civ since the original back in the 90s, and over the years its changed dramatically. Yet even inspite loving this game there are a few things i find really disapointing. But first the stuff I love.........

1: Two Tech Trees
Yea you read that correct, instead of having the old standard tech tree there is a second one that covers your civic abilities. These in hand effect how you govern or opens up more to how you can govern better to your preferred style. For instance one of my favourite abilities from Civ4 'Serfdom' has reappeared and the way this ability works is pretty great.

2: Still Fight Barbarians
in previous games when you reach a certain age or a unit reaches a certain experience I have found that those units no longer gain experience when fighting barbarians, thats now changed. you can still level a unit but unfortunatly its at a very slower rate than if your up against a civilization target. Yet still its good that when you come up against mauraders trying to pillage your sea tiles that you can be rewarded.

3: Districts
At first I wasn't sure if I liked the idea of districts or not but I think the more I play the more I like. The idea behind districts is that your cities are not just on one tile but can spread out over several tiles. This in my opinion can be a blessing or a curse. It can be a blessing if you find the right spot to build a city and there are plenty of boosters for your districts like Mountains or rainforests for science districts. The curse comes more with the lack of space issue. Especially if you land in a location and raise a city only because you find valuable resources, but the city could fail to see its potential due to a lack of district space. The game forces you to make more wiser decisions.


Those are the main likes, here are my main dislikes.....

1: All roads lead to Rome?
Err no they don't, the way you build roads has been redeveloped for some bizare reason and they no longer have the abilities of earlier Civ games. First of all your builders no longer create roads, only traders and a new engineer unit can build roads. If you task a trader to trade with another one of your cities it creates a road on its path. If you use an engineer, the unit only lasts for 2 active turns and then disappears, they seem to be a waste of time imo............ Roads no longer give you any advantage anymore, they don't provide added tile wealth like in previous games, and they don't really offer any movement advance for units, e.g. 3 tiles instead of one, in fact I have seen units avoid roads for some reason.

2: Oh and the same for builders
Thats right, with no modifications your builders only have three active turns, meaning that you can only get them to develop three tiles. So for example in previous games if you wanted to say redevelop a pasture hill with rainforest to build a mine, it might take e,g, 10 turns to do everything from cut down the rainforest and then build the mine, now it take 2 of your 3 goes, one to cut down the trees one to build mine. The only saving grace is that every action is instant, cutting trees take one turn, building a mine is one turn etc etc. I am not entirely sure why the devs have done this, and especially why they have changed the way roads are built and work. my only conclusion is to reduce map congestion, but that should be left to the player to decide.  I used to love having a transport ship filled with builders who follow and invasion in case I have used nukes or if I need to redevelop the infastructure. Can't really do that now.

3: Boot polish can make it shine
Well I think in this case there is a distint lack of polish and especially when the game costs £50 - £70 depending on what version you get before any discount is alarming. There are a lot of bugs in this game and things missing that I would expect from previous games from the get go.  One bug is when a Civ tries to contact you but then does nothing, the animation is still playing for the civ leader but no pop ups, Why does this happen? Well I have worked out that parts of the game work to quickly, and when the game is catching up the game crashes. This is not a PC speed issue as it would happen all the time otherwise. Another bug which I have experienced and it seems reading the reviews for the game so have others, other leaders are easy to piss off. For instance if you build a wonder or choose a different form of government, other world leaders seem to go into a nerd rage.

Also why do the devs still insist on not having transport ships and forcing one unit per tile, its so redundant and slow, also where are my paratroopers? I love paras as they offer a great dynamic to combat.

4: A lack of consequence
One of the things I loved about Civ4 (imo my favourite version I think) was that every important game changing task you did had concequences. For example, you got caught spying big time, it had consequences, you have developed Nukes, it had concequences. Now nothing does. I had caught a civ trying to steal cash and sabotage districts, and in spite the fact they apologised, they did it again several turn later. I declared war which seemed the only way to stop them, but I turned out to be the bad guy for doing this and ruined the end game because everyone hated me and called me a warmounger. Put this down to a bug or intentional, either way it ruined my game.

5: Out pricing the future
Yep as it seems with all games these days the polish comes in the form of overpriced DLCs. At £25 I think I will wait for the sales before I purchase "Rise and Fall". 


It seems that I actually hate this game considering that I put more negatives but I don't, I struggle to hate any Civ game even when newer versions remove the stuff I really loved. 66770959.review:
Right, so I held off on writing a review for this game for too long. I've over 1000 hours in so it's probably about time, eh?

Q: Is this game better than Civ V?
A: In my opinion, yes, but it seems to be the unpopular opinion. I've been an avid fan of the series since Civilization II, and for whatever reason, Civ V "did it for me" the least out of all games in the series (Minus Civ Revolution, we don't talk about Civ Revolution). I cannot put my finger on it exactly, but Civ V always felt--phoned in to me, which is not to say that Civ 6 isn't also lacking in many ways.

Q: What makes Civ 6 better than Civ V?
A: Though it was a weird concept at first, I love the district system of Civ 6 and would have an even more difficult time playing Civ V today than I did when I first got into that game. I wasn't a fan of the cartoonish graphics when I first started playing Civ 6, but it's gotten to the point where I don't even notice it anymore (plus, there are mods to get around that if it really bothers you, a theme you might notice in this review). I like the way Civ 6 handles pretty much all of the core mechanics over Civ V and the government system, though basic compared to Civ V, is superior in my opinion. The cards system gives you a lot more "realistic" control over your empire, compared to the system provided in Civ V, which sort of locked you onto a path and made it very time consuming to change directions in a pinch. Civ 6 feels more dynamic in that regard, allowing a nation to adapt at a much more realistic pace to any wars or events taking place at the time.

Q: How do units compare in Civ 6 compared to Civ V?
A: This is one where I have to give a slight nod to Civ V. It annoyed me to no end how limited the player was in unit choice in Civ V compared to Civ IV for the sake of simplicity, going from wooden sailing ships to ironclads always baffled me (what happened to the steam cruisers and the like?). That being said, unmodded Civ 6 is even worse in this regard, taking you from musketmen to WWI style infantry. This causes weird situations against the AI where the AI will bee-line Anti-Tank Infantry because there are less requirements for Anti-Cavalry units (in general), so even if you are the technological superpower, you might be going up against AT Infantry with your Musketmen because of the massive gap in units by era. I refuse to play Civ 6 without modding this factor out of relevance and the mods on offer nicely fix the gaps presented in Civ 6 and Civ 5.

Q: What about unit classes?
A: Again, Civ V is a little bit stronger in this regard. Civ 6 takes an extremely weird approach where machine gunners are your basic ranged infantry in the late game, replacing field cannons. What? Yeah, it confused me too! Again, I have to use mods to get around this issue. There are mods out there that add two or more types of range classed units for all eras (anti-infantry, siege, etc.) instead of just making the "ranged" class a generic and confusing mess like it is in Civ 6 unmodded. That being said, I do like the various types of support classes in Civ 6 and the fact that religious units occupy their own layer (not true in the early days of Civ 6).

Q: What is the ideal way to play Civ 6?
A: In my opinion, the ideal way to play Civ 6 is with the biggest possible map size, Epic speed (sometimes Marathon), maximum number of AI, with one or two friends (anymore than that and it's hard to get everyone on at the same time for a long game). It's also ideal to include any number of mods you deem necessary to have a good time and to fix many of the vanilla issues with the game. Why is this the ideal way to play? Because I enjoy a "Risk" like experience that can realistically take several weeks to a month to finish. Wars are long and grueling like they can be in real life, requiring you to think and adapt to the situation. Plus, it's a lot of fun working with (and against) people you know personally, either in real life or online.

Q: How's the AI?
A: Awful. Even with mods that enhance the AI, I've found the AI to be kind of brain dead, which is where perhaps one of my greatest frustrations with the game lie. I've had games of Civ 6 where pretty close to zero wars happen (yet the AI is constantly denouncing each other, or you and insulting you endlessly) and I've had games where the AI will declare a rather mysterious war all of a sudden, only to get beaten back effortlessly, resulting in a great deal of territory lost due to their miscalculation. I will say that I find the diplomatic side of the AI in Civ 6 to be better than Civ V, but as far as strategy and actually thinking militarily, the AI is just as bad as it was in Civ V. Civ IV with the Legend of Revolutions Mod or Caveman to Cosmos has had the best AI in the series to date, in my opinion.

Q: Will I like Civ 6?
A: Well, that depends. If you loved Civ V, my guess is you won't love Civ 6, but hear me out. If you take the time to find the mods that fix the many issues with the game (especially the unit gaps in technology) and can find a few chums to enjoy it with you, I also recommend purchasing all of the expansions when/if you can, as it adds a lot of extra content to the game that is even new to the series. As a busy adult, I do believe Civ 6 is the only game I currently have in my Steam, GOG, etc. libraries that has breached the 1000 hour mark, maybe even the 500 hour mark at this point. That being said, I love the concept of building and living through the rise (and fall?) of an empire from start to conclusion and witnessing geopolitics on a global stage, and very few games are able to provide me that kind of experience, so your miles may vary.

Again, I find myself in the strange situation of having to give a Positive review even though my feelings are somewhere closer to the middle, but that is nothing new to the Steam review experience. Thanks for taking the time to read this little review.

32861499.review:
Ok, This is my very first review so it's gonna be extremely confusing and completely baseless. 

1.) Let's go with the basic simple review, is this better than Civ 5?
- Eh, it's more flexible i guess. In Civ 5, i either kill everyone and conquer every cities on the planet or just turtle up myself with any number the tradition policies told me too. Districts system is good that you could give your cities their actual characteristic, probably the best part of Civ 6. Eureka systems are good but sometimes lead to repeatitive early game interactions like "Try to kill barbarian with this Slinger" or "Make 2 Galleys", some of them also depend on map RNG.

2.)Is the game well-balanced?
- Lol, nope. Some Civs are very strong since the Ancient Era while some are like playing without any bonuses until Renaissance. Babarian can be annoying most of the time, sometime they went full Genghis Khan and dunk 5 Horsemen into your face on very early game (I think Babarian condition that "If they are any Horse resource nearby, they will make even more Horsemen" are work even with horses in your cities). City-States do something weird as well, some will never make more than 5 units, some will make 10+ units and make traffic on the continent worse than morning rush hours, so ally with some City-state don't improve your army while some could eradicate some armies for you. City start could be very bad or extremely good, coastal start like Spain or England could be pretty bad.
-Edit: Somehow 2K went buffing and nerfing some Civs, Norway, England and Spainish got buffs and Kongo got a nerf.(DLC Civs are still OP, no worry). Barbarians're still annoying, I don't think they touched this part anyway. 

3.)Is patching, bug fix or A.I improvement come fast?
-Edit: 2K seem to give out the seasonal patch and update(?), some of it actually make the game better while some of them are pretty bad(like making Alliance with A.I. in latest patches which is pretty annoying)

4.)2K sell so many DLCs, should I support them?
- No idea, Just be yourself. The prices are a little higher than a TCG pack in my country, so i'm not that mad about it. 

5.)Should I purchase it now?
-If  it's on sale and you will play it right now, yes. If you want to play it later, No, wait for better patch or expansion.

TL;DL: It's good game design and improvement over Civ5, but still need more patches and balancing. The decision is up to you, but for me it worth it, maybe.

Edit: Ok after realize so many people actually read my gibberish review so I guess I will update the update, patching, and some other parts.

58044993.review:
'얼마 못 해봤지만 꽤 재미있네요' 같은 내용을 쓰고 싶지만, 
그러기엔 플레이 시간이 너무 짧고 세일기간에 이 게임을 구입하시려는 분들을 위해서 좀 진중하게 글을 씁니다.

이 게임은 재미있습니다.
확실히 이 게임은 오리지널 이후 흥망성쇠, 몰려드는 폭풍 두 확장팩과 정기적인 버그수정과 AI수정, 밸런스패치 등을 거쳐
상당히 수위급에 올라온 게임이 되었습니다. 특히 멍청했던 전투인공지능, 산출 우선순위 문제, 해양스타팅의 불리함 등을
최근 2019년 9월 패치로 손 본 이후 예전처럼 어줍잖게 달려들어도 전투를 날로먹을 수 있는 수준에서 벗어나
AI도 자신이 강한 타이밍을 알고, 날뛰는 타이밍을 잡을 줄 알며, 비상에도 적극적으로 임합니다. 

그럼에도 아직까지 평가가 반전되기 어려운 것은 역시 비교대상이 있기 때문입니다. 
문명 5로 문명 시리즈를 처음 접하셨던 분들은 문명 6 특유의 특수지구 시스템과 달라진 내정,외교,심시티 방법을 잘 모르시기에
진입 장벽이 조금 높음을 느끼실 수 있습니다. 
또 하나의 개선점이기도 한, 진입장벽으로 느낄 수 있는 것은 초,중,후반 끊임없이 여러분을 괴롭히는 야만인들의 무리입니다.
야만인을 얕보시면 안됩니다. 문명 5 때 야만인 부흥을 킨 것보다 더 거세고, 더 빠르게 여러분을 조지러 옵니다.
어 야만인이네? 잡아야 하는데 병력이 없네? 국경으로 들어오네? 근데 문명 6은 도시 포격이 없네?
성벽을 올려야 포격이 된다고? 어 야만인이 내 타일 약탈하네? 열받네? -> 게임종료
이렇게 되기전에 확실히 야만인 대책을 세우셔야 합니다. 

이야기가 많이 새버렸습니다마는, 확실히 비싼 게임이 맞지만, 세일 폭이 꽤 클 세일 기간 때 쯤, 문명 5 접하신 분들 당연히 문명 6에도 눈이 어느정도 돌아가실 텐데,  결론부터 말씀드리자면, 문명 5와 문명 6은 아주 많이 다른 게임입니다.
아예 다른 방식으로 접근하셔야 합니다. 문5 했던 것처럼 문6을 접하시면 현자타임 오기가 아주- 아주- 쉬울테니까 난이도를 낮추시고 천천히 배워나가세요.
심시티 계획, 정책카드, 도시국가 사절 관리, 개척자 뽑는 타이밍, 고인접 특수지구 배치법 등등
퀄리티 운영을 위한 디테일이 살아있는 게임이라 파고들면 파고 들 수록 운빨게임이라기보단 운영게임이라는 것을 더 체감하실 수 있기를 바라며 이만 글을 줄이겠습니다.

51303462.review:
我是第1次因为文明系列优惠而购买文明6的,但坦率的讲，即使我推荐这款游戏，但我还是觉得即使出了两款dlc之后，文明6还是一款半成品游戏。
首先马丘比丘不能用秦始皇的工人加速和使用大工程师，我觉得这完全是一个bug。凭什么工人能建滑雪场能建穿山隧道就是不能上山。其次，我个人是非常喜欢真实地地球的地图的。但是在风云变幻更新之后，真实地球居然根本不能建水电站和堤坝，这难道不是bug吗？希望官方能尽快修正这两个bug。
其次，真实地球的地图实在是太小了，希望官方的依照，真实亚洲和真实欧洲的地图大小，把真实地球的地图放大3~5倍，然后增加像例如熏香，柑橘等等原本真实地球地图没有的奢侈品。做出一个能容纳24个城邦，或许可以有8~10个自然奇观，起码每个大洲一个吧，现在的真实地球地图，北美没有奇观，澳洲没有奇观，欧洲也没有奇观。wtf
在现阶段的游戏中，水渠完全就是一个鸡肋性的建筑，很多人都愿意快速出城市化建社区，也不愿意建水渠，不过既然都已经出了黑死病场景了，为什么不在游戏中添加瘟疫因素呢？下水道和水渠都可以减少城市发生瘟疫的概率，科技中也可以增加防疫，抗生素的科技。人口机制也过于死板，为什么不可以从人口已经满了的城市中，把人口迁移到新建的城市中呢，不然后期的城市发展速度太慢了。
我觉得文明6为什么不能买一下像权力的游戏之类的版权呢？设计一个文明6版本的中土大陆，或者冰与火之歌中的大陆，不同样具有可玩性娱乐性和噱头吗？电脑设计的随机地图是相当没有特色的，真的强烈希望，文明6可以出一个官方设计的地图包，甚至你们可以直接买玩家自己设计的mod不是吗？
我不知道文明6是不是不鼓励玩家过度扩张,但就我个人体验而言,当玩家建设的超过20座城市时文明6就成了一场噩梦。即使有以上的不足，但是文明6还是一款很有趣的游戏，不过还是希望官方能进一步加速完善

26179986.review:
Ich war äußerst überrascht, dass es so viele schlechte Reviews hier gibt. Deshalb wollte ich einige Aussagen kontern, da ich diese absolut nicht nachvollziehen kann und natürlich auch meine eigene Meinung formulieren.
(Anmerkung: Ich spiele das Spiel auf Englisch, da mir die deutsche Übersetzung nicht gefällt ("Ausrichtungen"? Wirklich?) und ich Sean Bean als Sprecher überragend finde. Daher könnten einige Begriffe unklar sein, da ich deren deutsche Übersetzung nicht kenne. Google hilft da im Zweifel.)

Konter-Kritik:

1. Comic-Grafik
Wer sich darüber beschwert, hat wohl den Schuss nicht gehört.
Natürlich ist es Geschmackssache. Allerdings steht seit Monaten fest, wie das Spiel aussehen wird und sich jetzt im nachhinein darüber zu beschweren finde ich irgendwie daneben.
Ich persönlich finde die Grafik besser, da sie dem Spiel mehr Übersichtlichkeit bietet. Die Strategische Ansicht sieht übrigens richtig spitze aus! (Außer man schiebt einen kindisch-trotzigen Hass auf diese Grafik...)
[Ich habe an manchen Stellen auch gelesen, dass das Interface nicht schön und unübersichtlich sei. Das kann ich wirklich nicht mal im geringsten nachvollziehen. Ich finde es äußerst gelungen.]

2. Civ 5 war besser
In einigen Reviews gab es die Aussage, dass Civ 5 viel besser sei, das 6er noch nicht ausgereift sei, man merkt dass noch viele DLCs kommen müssen usw...
Ich persönlich habe am 6er zwar trotzdem viel mehr Spaß als am 5er und würde dieser Aussage auch keineswegs zustimmen, kann sie aber auch ein Stück weit nachvollziehen.
An eine Release Version eines Civilization Spiels solche Ansprüche zu stellen, ist aber einfach völlig unrealistisch. Und eine Release Version mit einer seit Jahren gepatchten und mit vielen DLCs verstärkten Version zu vergleichen, halte ich für noch fragwürdiger.
Spielt mal Civ 5 oder Civ 4 ohne DLCs, also in ihrer Release Version! Das ist eine ganz andere Liga und Welten(!!) darunter.
Hier wurden Äpfel mit Birnen verglichen und unrealistische Ansprüche gestellt.

3. Die KI ist dumm
Ja da muss ich leider zustimmen. Die KI ist tatsächlich mal wieder richtig schlecht, wie in eigentlich allen Civ Teilen davor.
Die Agendas der verschiedenen Leader führen auch oft zu frühen Denunzierungen und vielen Kriegen, was auf Dauer etwas zu viel erscheint. Und auch in Civ 6 führt die Schwierigkeit nicht zu einer klügeren KI, sondern einfach zu Boni für die KI bzw Mali für den Spieler.
Dennoch sollte man auch diesen Aspekt differenziert betrachten.
a) Eine KI zu programmieren ist schon ein unglaublich komplexes unterfangen. Eine KI zu programmieren, die verschieden "schlau" ist, halte ich in so einem komplexen Spiel für nahezu unmöglich.
b) Viele Kriege gab es auch in echt immer. Gab es jemals einen Zeitpunkt in der Geschichte der Menschheit, in der nicht irgendwo Krieg herrschte? (Ja ich weiß, das ist ein schwaches Argument, aber ich wollte es dennoch erwähnen)
c) Auch hier gilt wieder: es ist eine Release Version. Es wird Patches geben und es wird Mods geben. Die Entwickler werden mit den gesammelten Informationen, die sich nach dem Release ergeben, sicher etwas anzufangen wissen.


Nachdem ich nun einige Kritikpunkte kritisiert habe, komme ich noch zu den positiven Aspekten, die hier bei den Reviews leider untergehen:

- Unstacking the Cities
Dieses Feature war eines der ersten, die öffentlich gezeigt und beworben wurden und ich finde zurecht.
Es gibt dem Spiel eine nie dagewesene Komplexität und man kommt ständig ins Grübeln, wo man welchen Distrikt platziert, damit es sich im Verlauf des Spiels auch am besten auszahlt. 
Es verleiht der Kriegsführung auch eine neue Dimension. Man muss nicht unbedingt krieg führen um seinen Gegner zu besiegen und seine Städte zu übernehmen. Man kann auch einfach in sein Reich einmaschieren, einige Bezirke plündern und so gleichzeitig seinen Gegner schwächen und sich selbst stärken.
Außerdem bügelt es einen der (meiner Meinung nach) größten Schwächen der Vorgänger aus: das stupide Verbessern aller Felder um die Stadt. Früher hat man einfach alle Felder um die Stadt verbessert. Durch die nicht Verbrauchbaren Arbeiter musste man sich eigentlich nur entscheiden, was man zuerst Ausbaut. Welche Verbesserung man baut war häufig klar, da es nur eine oder zwei wirklich sinnvolle Entscheidungen gab. Hier hat man nun wesentlich mehr zu überdenken, was mir sehr gefällt.
Städte müssen nun auch nicht mehr am Meer gebaut sein, um Schiffe bauen zu können. Ein kleines aber unglaublich gutes und wichtiges Feature!

- Civics (Ausrichtungen)
Der Ersatz für die Sozialpolitiken ist ebenfalls eine meiner Lieblingsfeatures.
In Civ 5 war man hier noch sehr beschränkt auf einige Bäume, die man wenn angefangen auch durcharbeiten musste um an einen starken Bonus zu kommen. Das war alles sehr steif und für mich sehr unbefriedigend. Ich musste mich durch einige Boni "kämpfen", die ich evtl nicht besonders nützlich fand, um an einen bestimmten Bonus zu kommen, den ich wirklich wollte.
Mit dem neuen Kartensystem hat man sehr viel Flexibilität und kann auf verschiedene Situationen reagieren. So wie Politik auch in echt funktioniert: Gesetze werden Anhand der momentanen Situation eingeführt, abgeschafft, verändert.

- Beförderungen für Einheiten
Machen hier einfach viel mehr Spaß. Ich fand es in Civ 5 immer komisch, mich zwischen offenem und unwegsamen Gelände entscheiden zu müssen. Die Boni die es jetzt gibt, sind wesentlich differenzierter und werden einem auch direkt in einem übersichtlichen Skill-Tree präsentiert. Ich habe nun das Gefühl, meine Einheiten sind wesentlich wertvoller.

- Casus Belli
Endlich! Das war eine der absolut schlechtesten Sachen in Civ 5: Ich erkläre jemandem den Krieg, der mir zuvor eine Stadt geklaut hat oder seine Religion wie wild bei mir verbreitet. Ich habe also einen guten Grund ihm den Krieg zu erklären. Trotzdem hassen mich danach alle, sehen mich als Kriegstreiber ab. 
Nun kann ich die Kriege die ich führe endlich begründen. Wenn beispielsweise ein Gegner einen Stadtstaat erobert, kann ich diesen später wieder befreien. Wenn ich die dafür vorgesehene Funktion benutze ("Liberation War") und es schaffe, den Staat zu befreien, erhalte ich KEINEN Kriegstreiber Malus. Ich habe ja schließlich den Bösen besiegt und die Stadt befreit. 
Es gibt auch heilige Kriege. Wenn der Gegner zum Beispiel mal wieder mit seinen Missionaren ankommt und mir das nicht passt, kann ich ihm einen Heiligen Krieg erklären, wodurch der Malus um 25% abgeschwächt wird. 
Das macht alles sehr viel Sinn und erspart einem einige Frustration.

Es gibt noch viele andere kleinere Features, die ich unglaublich schätze und das Spiel einfach besser machen, als seine Vorgänger. Dazu gehören zum Beispiel:
- Berge sind endlich nicht mehr nutzlos
- Man kann Map-Marker setzen
- verschiedene Leader
- Frischwasser ist wichtig --> mehr Komplexität
- Naturwunder sind wesentlich stärker
- die Verscheidenen Civs und Leader haben wesentlich mehr Charakter und verschiedenere Vor- und Nachteile. In Civ 5 haben sich im Vergleich alle sehr ähnlich gespielt.
...

Fazit:
Ja, das Spiel hat noch seine Schwächen. Das muss man klar und deutlich sagen. Ich persönlich finde es zwar jetzt schon besser als seine Vorgänger. Wie bereits erwähnt, kann ich es aber auch nachvollziehen, wenn vielen Leuten hier noch der Schliff fehlt.
Aber es ist nunmal eine Release Version. Version 1.0, sozusagen. Davon darf man sich bei Firaxis einfach nicht zu viel erhoffen, sonst wird man zwangsläufig enttäuscht.
Von allen Civilization Teilen ist dies aber mit großem(!!) Abstand die ausgereifteste Release(!) Version, die es jemals gab. Das ist Fakt, da kann man argumentieren wie man will.
Wenn dann erstmal die ersten Patches und DLCs kommen, wird dieses Spiel immer besser und besser.
Angesichts dieser Tatsache bin ich absolut davon überzeugt, dass dies das beste Civilization wird, das es jemals gab.

72528935.review:
First off, let me state this is a review for Civ 6 with all the DLC (including the frontier pass although only 1 pack has been release at time of writing). If you want a review of vanilla Civ 6...well its fairly good, but if you are not gonna buy the complete version of Civ 6 you may as well get the complete versions of Civ 4 or Civ 5. They are both better and cheaper than vanilla Civ 6.

TL;DR - It can't quite beat Civ 5 in my eyes, which I still consider the peak of the series. A massive roster of civs/leaders/city states, a second tech tree for culture, and fleshed out diplomacy get it close to beating Civ 5, but the janky AI and the loss of most of the grandiose atmosphere that I come to expect from the genre keep it from surpassing it. The huge amount of choices and variety still make it a great game that I highly recommend, as long as you get the complete package.

Pros:
+ [i]Massive[/i] pool of civs to choose from (46 leaders and almost as many civs!). There is more unique stuff for each civ, with a special perk coming from both the civ AND the leader in additional to two (sometimes more) unique "things" (units, improvements, buildings, etc). Makes for a ton of stuff to see and use.

+ Diplomacy has gotten some really good improvements and refinements. Lots of casus bellis (reasons for war) give you many ways to wage war and take cities without the world treating you like the damn Devil himself for the rest of the game. Several different alliance types that allow you to choose the kind of buffs you want. Personality traits for civs that reveal over the course of the game, some of them randomized, so you are not (usually) universally loved or hated. The world congress is pretty interesting and makes the Diplomatic Victory fairly different from other types.

+ Government system. Like with the amount of civs and leaders, the sheer number of options here adds to the variety that is probably Civ 6's greatest strength. A card system with different categories that allows a lot of fine tuning and frequent switching of buffs to whatever your current short term and long term goals are.

+ Great people have been turned into unique versions where no two Great Engineers/Scientists/etc are the same. This might be my favorite change from V to VI. It makes for more interesting buffs, especially when you are obtaining many of the same type of great people. Some even give you things separate from the their type (a great general giving you a relic for faith and tourism, a great scientist giving you faith buffs)

+ City states are also now completely unique. There are still general types like scientific and religious, but now each and every one has a different suzerain bonus. Buffs from anything to various trade route bonuses to unique military units to adding the ability for your religious units to earn you science.

Cons:
- Tone. Quotes from techs and wonders have always enhanced Civ and really gave some ambience to wherever you were at in history. It really pains me to say that many of Civ 6's quotes are vapid and moronic and are so detrimental to the grand scale and subject matter of the game that it borders on irreverent. Monty Python quotes and references to having no wifi on mountains do not prop up my feelings of building a grandiose nation in an awe inspiring world. The writing for the leaders is mostly safe from this, but there are a couple lines that make you roll your eyes. Shoutout to the Proverbium mod for muting the narrator and replacing the worst offenders for bad quotes.

- AI. This is not the Civ entry that breaks the series' reputation for janky, sometimes braindead AI. I play Civ almost exclusively single player, so its not enough to ruin the game for me by any stretch, but I am disappointed whenever I see the AI throw troops against a wall doing almost zero damage or sticking with an old government when they have newer, objectively more powerful options. Higher difficulties have no effect on this, instead it just gives buffs to your enemies with things like +1 combat strength.

- World Map. I adore playing on a real life globe map but in 6, it is locked to a standard size map, which is way too small and I just do not understand the decision to make it that way.

- Loss of vertical empires. In Civ 5, having a small amount or large amount of cities were both viable options. This is absolutely not the case in Civ 6. More cities, as long as you don't expand at a reckless speed, is objectively what you want. The so called "one city challenge" in 5 wasn't so much of a challenge as in a different way to play. Fun and viable. Trying that in Civ 6 will absolutely cripple you and is pretty much impossible in everything excluding some extremely specific circumstances.

Minor stuff:

- The leaders have a good amount of animation, but I am just not a big fan of the art style they chose for them. Some of the leaders look wonky, and they all just...stand there with a static image behind them. In Civ 5 you had queens standing near railings of palaces, warlords with the backdrop of a burning city, kings sitting upon their thrones. The animations and different stances bases on your relationship in Civ 6 cannot compete with that. I was also disappointed to see some reused animations for newer leaders.

- Music. I guess its a mixed bag. In particular some of the newer Civs brought some good music, but as a whole its rather average (with some poor songs) and can get grating with the frequency of replayed tracks.

+/- Religion/religious victory. Alright I guess it isn't "minor" but I have a mixed opinion on it. More victory types are always good, and religious combat makes for a less passive victory type, but it can be very easy to obtain and can happen in a flash.

+ You can place pins on the map for things like "settle here" or reminders like "declare war on turn 108". There is also a search bar to look for and highlight things like particular resources. They are wonderful quality of life additions that you will quickly learn to rely on.

+/-/? Multiplayer. I have played very little, but I can assure you it works fairly well (I remember the dark days where Civ 5 MP was straight up unplayable...) The limitation of playing the two largest map types hurts though. Also there is a battle royale mode. I haven't tried it, but it did just get updated, so I guess it wasn't the flash-in-the-pan mode it sounded like to me.

72663349.review:
[h1] Ультимативный обзор на варваров [/h1]
     Многие думают, что Civilization это серия игр про борьбу между великими державами за мировое господство, но это ошибочное мнение. Философский смысл этой игры заключается в том, что  всегда есть тот, кто следит свыше и тот, кто направляет события в нужном направлении. Вы наверное думаете, что я говорю про климатические события из Gathering storm? Значит вы также сильно заблуждаетесь, так же как и я когда начинал играть в эту игру. Как бы вы хорошо не начинали партию, как бы хорошо не просчитывали свои ходы и ресурсы, какой бы огромной военной мощью вы не обладали настанет тот момент, когда вы посмотрев в нижний правый угол экрана начнете кликать по карте в надежде, что кара настигла кого-то другого. [b]"В окрестностях обосновался аванпост варваров"[/b] это событие может перевернуть для вас всю игру. 
     В начале игры они не станут трогать вашего поселенца так, как они знают, что вы еще встретитесь. Пока вы изучаете горное дело у них давно есть все нужные для них технологии. Варвары не воюют между собой, они держат связь через несколько континентов, чтобы согласовать свои планы. Вы вели войну с Китаем? с Римом? с Османами? Их это не интересует, так как они давно превзошли по развитию все возможные цивилизации. Они поняли, что война это лишь развлечение и способ самореализации. Строительство городов? Их аванпост превосходит по науке, культуре, производстве ваши города на 2 эпохи вперед. Их копейщики по дисциплине и стойкости превосходят любого суперсолдата, который потратил несколько десяток лет на тренировки. Они знают, что в случае их поражения придут другие, поэтому увидев ОБР 3 уровня их нога не дрогнет, они не оставят свой аванпост, они даже будут готовы в случае вашего приближения пойти в атаку.
    Даже если вы захотите мирно развивать свои города не ввязываясь ни с кем в войну одна не изученная клетка тундры это исправит. Армия из лучников, дуболомов с катапультами и таранами будет уничтожать все на своем пути. Вы будете тратить все свое золото и производство на военные юниты чтобы попытаться защитить свои города. За каждый уничтоженный варварский юнит приходит 2 новых. Уничтожив все ваши города и оставив столице 1 хп они не прекратят ваши страдания, они издевательски будут продолжать атаковать вашу столицу. Им не важно сколько ресурсов у них на это уйдет, так как их возможности безграничны. Их цели кажутся нам абсурдными, просто они культурно вышли за рамки. Они верны своим традициям, если они грабили каменоломни дуболомами в 1000 году до н.э., то варварская ПТ команда в 1996 году сделает это снова, даже если им придется пройти сквозь 3 ваших города с военными лагерями. 
      В общем как написано в главной книге варваров: "У варвара нет цели, только путь, а путь варвара - это грабить каменоломни"

73250760.review:
Recomiendo el juego siempre que se compre en oferta, y creo que con el juego base tenéis de sobra para disfrutarlo.

No trae muchas novedades con respecto a su anterior entrega, excepto los distritos, y nuevos lideres claro.

Lo compré porque estaba rebajado y porque se podía jugar con Felipe II, un GRANDE de España.

Pero sigue teniendo los mismos fallos graves que llevan arrastrando casi desde el primer civilization.

Uno de los que más me desagrada es lo MAL, pero MAL, que diseñan el mapa mundial, que debería parecerse más a la realidad pero no hay manera.

Naciones como España o Japón no aparecen apenas en este mapa como pequeños pegotes de tierra, y son grandes Naciones.

El tema de la IA, y sus negociaciones comerciales o políticas, como siempre son una M bien grande, la máquina es una hipócrita que siempre exige mucho, aunque este contra las cuerdas, sigue CHULEANDOTE en sus negociaciones de paz o comerciales.

La gestión de los ejércitos en este CVI es regular tirando a mala se podría mejorar.
Las animaciones de algunas fichas militares son a veces muy infantiles, como por ejemplo el tanque moderno, que le haces zoom y parece de un juego infantil, o algunas unidades terrestres.

Las "ventajas" de cada civilización se quedan en nada, al pasar el tiempo, porque ya me dirán que hacen los conquistadores Españoles, en cuanto salen los blindados, la unidad se caduca enseguida, y lo mismo con el resto de civilizaciones, Si quieres ganar militarmente, tendrás que tener una buena reserva de misiles ICBM, para poder ganar la guerra. 

De todas formas sigue siendo adictivo y se disfrutan esas explosiones nucleares están muy logradas.

España UGL.

72718847.review:
Moinsen!

nach über 300 Stunden wage ich auch mal ein "kurzes" Review. Ich muss sagen, dass ich Civ seit dem zweiten Teil spiele und in fast allen Teilen schon über 500 Stunden abgeleistet habe.

Zwar wurden in Civ 6 das Rad nicht unbedingt neu erfunden, was die Features angeht, aber diese mit so einer Perfektion umgesetzt, dass es das Spiel auch nach so vielen Stunden immer noch spielbar macht. (Das ist ja heute nicht mehr ganz so einfach, weil Spiele häufig nach kurzer Zeit nicht mehr spielbar sind - meine Meinung.) 

Zurzeit spiele ich eine Giant Earth Karte, mit 30 Zivilisationen. Die Ladezeiten sind extrem kurz bei meinem Intel Core i7 8700k - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070Ti und meiner Samsung SSD850 EVO 1TB, auch in der 235 Runde im Jahr 2045 :-)

Klare Empfehlung meinerseits!

Aus meiner Sicht sind die Erweiterungen Gathering Storm und Rise & Fall ein Muss, um alle tollen Spielfunktionen richtig nutzen zu können. Diese wurden in den letzten Monaten auch sehr toll ausbalanciert - Hut ab. Mit einigen tollen Mods lassen sich zusätzliche Ressourcen und kleine Spielverbesserungen (Deaktivierung der Killerroboter, welche ich unsinnig finde) oder Optimierungen was Religion und Wirtschaft angeht, implementieren.

73247860.review:
远方的旅人啊，你终于到达了这里。几千年来，我看见多少帝国跟文明灰飞烟灭。 
高耸入云的纪念碑坍塌在曾经辉煌的城市里，多少奇观跟伟人也最终逝去。
我看见天上的星辰流转，地上的草木更替。
繁华的都市成了废墟，伟大的领袖也终将死去。
不断的战争跟天灾让人民心生疲倦，但是我们结束了一切。
我们的成就终将被一代又一代的子孙念起，在万神殿里，在先贤祠中。我抬头仰望那些不朽的祖先，而他们也在俯视着我。
我看着欣喜若狂的人民，注视着他们朴实的面貌跟欢喜的神情。
我又看见了，我看见了那白日中天空出现了两行流星！ 我还看见了！那卑微的人类，也登上了宇宙！

-------------------------------------分割线---------------------------------------------

从水下第一个生命的萌芽开始…到石器时代的巨型野兽…再到人类第一次直立行走，您已经历许多。现在，开启您最伟大的探索吧：从早期文明的摇篮到浩瀚星宇。

从卑微的最初，你就展示出非凡的成长力。从青铜到钢铁，用马匹和刀剑来统治吧。天空开始揭露出自己的秘密，宇宙让我们为之惊叹，星空指引我们来到异国海岸。

你用石头建立了许多城市，见证了早期帝国的崛起与衰落。不久你将站在城堡高耸的尖塔之下，周围是你勇敢的骑士，关于你国民的故事将从这里写起。如同年轻学徒学习握剑一样，你会逐渐了解自己在这个世界上的位置

从步枪的枪管到天空中的花火，新的动力不断产生。甚至新印刷的书刊里安安静静的文字也蕴含着巨大变化。这个世界曾经又大又神秘，如今已变得越来越小，越来越熟悉。然而，总有问题有待解决，总有信仰需要经受考验，总有民族认同需要形成

机器嗡嗡响个不停、烟味刺鼻、灰烬和煤烟遮挡住视线——这是时代变迁的标志。科学和文化进步的诱惑是推动你的王国不断向前发展的动力。现在，你面临的挑战是维持地球和人类、和平与战争之间微妙的平衡。

早先，有很多关于飞人的传说。如今，你位于这些传说成为现实的临界点。通过飞行和新的通讯方式，你能创造出一个又小又亲密的世界。但代价是什么呢?对于如何统治、如何生存的问题不同理解造成了全球冲突。在这种越来越吵闹不休的思想辩论中，你必须选择自己要走的路。

新发现的领域扩宽了我们的认知，从微小的原子到壮阔的外太空。我们比历史上任何时候都更接近真相，远远超过我们的理解范围。你需要选择如何使用这些知识，来击退前所未有的黑暗。

信息世界在你手掌之中，即时通信网络遍布全球。然而，还未有对未来的统一看法。我们在科技、文化和政治上不断竞争。我们拥有的致命武器可以摧毁我们整个星球。带领我们小心而大胆地前行，建立面向未来的全球社区。

建议配合美国原子能时代背景音乐食用 是啊 hard time come again no more，my amigo
当初文明我盗版玩了好几千个小时，到这几年才入正。当我在现实中精疲力竭，我总会打开这款游侠，看着我们伟大的文明渐行渐远...............
the end

73143935.review:
文明六（全DLC）评价。本人游戏技术说不上多好（神难度最好成绩300回合左右通关），算是有点游戏时长的娱乐玩家了。这款游戏陪伴了我300多个小时，也有些个人的体会。
个人认同的点：
1、美术风格和UI设计还是很讨喜的。我知道这一代整体上的卡通风格其实不符合有些玩家的预期，我也认为五代的奇观表现方式比起六代很有韵味，但在美术风格和UI上，这一代绝对是有进步的。
2、宗教体系蛮有意思的。既能辅助文化、征服也曾经能辅助飞天（合唱圣歌）。最主要的是宗教最好玩最吃操作的时段正是游戏本身最有意思的前中期，基本上每把游戏都还蛮有存在感的。
3、奇观独立建模和配音很不错。奇观占地块很不舒服，但表现力真的顶。
4、前中期探索的乐趣很高。抵挡蛮族，开拓海域，与城邦建交，与文明接触，进入文明时代，确实很有乐趣。总是，在讨厌的世界议会出来之前，六代比五代给我的体验是毫不逊色的。
几点牢骚：
1、暴铺比精铺收益高到不知道哪里去了。一方面由于奇观需要占地块，区域又不能拆使得暴铺圈地的收益大大提升而精铺则往往面临奇观和市政规划的冲突；另一方面忠诚度的设计多数情况下不过是给早战增加理由而已，我又不是阿基坦的埃利诺，比起商路巨作刷忠诚度和平演变，一波莽过去它不香嘛。
2、政体的切换简直就是过家家，市政的选取也缺乏现实基础。诚然，不同市政带来的不同加成组合很有意思也很有可玩性，但我一个资本主义政体的总统怎么就玩上集体化了呢，完全没有对于不同意识形态起码的尊重。
3、市政树与科技树有不合理的地方。尤里卡系统其实限制了玩家的发展方向，但我一个内陆国家发展不出航海难道就不能变身商人共和国了嘛，隔壁大明都能变身明卧儿（大雾）。同时，为什么我总是先点出喷气式轰炸机再点出双翼机呢（笑）。
4、部分科技与市政的导语稍显违和。不是说缺乏有意思的说明，而是说相比于奇观的说明，它们的说明有时显得太轻浮了。不过，未来时代的几个科技与市政的说明还是很有意思的。
5、整个【现代】的设计就是个败笔。首先，外交胜利不靠票数靠点数，疆土大的文明反而因为占领了几个原始首都而完全没有影响力，看看联合国的五常，我是真的不清楚这合理嘛？外交跟过家家一样，全AI百分之百同意诺贝尔奖和奥运会，没看到我这科技都领先两个时代了吗？其次，碳排放的设计上，整个游戏的清洁能源不是很麻烦就是根本不够用，碳捕集的收益又太低了。老实说，这都2020年了我们的碳排放量都在上升，排碳在我国是伴随着人类历史上最伟大的一次脱贫进程（之一？）上升的，很难说这种“生存排放”会成为每回合扣我9点外交支持的理由。全球变暖确实是现代一大问题，但开发者对于自然灾害机械性的强度和频率提升也让人怀疑这样的结果到底有没有现实基础。总的来说，开发者对【现代】的认识和我的观念不同。
6、领袖没创意。这个没话说，高棉、格鲁吉亚、哥伦比亚、玛雅到底是怎么在内部通过的？孟尼利克二世取得了阿杜瓦大捷，很厉害，但阿比西尼亚这个暮年的正统帝国，基督教世界在非洲的孤岛，在当时又如何称得上“伟大帝国”“主流文明”？威廉明娜同理。
7、有昂贵的DLC与坑人的季票。这个不做解释。
  虽然列出了这么多想发牢骚的点，但文明6仍是个很好的游戏。可能它没有《美丽新世界》那样出彩的DLC，没有厚重的历史表现力，但它有一流的中文配音、一流的奇观动画、一流的美术风格与UI设计，有中上的mc评分，不失为一部佳作。

73170598.review:
На мой взгляд очень даже хорошая стратегия,можно бросить уроки Истории и изучать её здесь.

Почему отрицательный отзыв?
1.Очень дорогие DLC за такое маленькое кол-во контента./
2.Неудобный интерфейс.
3.Тупые ИИ
4.Неправильные подсказки для новичков. 


Но сложность этой игры заключается в том что в игре присутствуют очень много сложных механик при разборе которых тебе сильно наскучивает игра. Если вы конечно не планируете остаться здесь хотя бы на 20 плюс часов, потому что только при таком времени вы будете понимать основные механики минусы и плюсы данной игры.

Как тут победить и в чем же заключается особенность данной игры.

 [h1] Военная победа [/h1]

Для военной  победы  необходимо захватить контроль над всеми столицами всех других цивилизаций. Обширный выбор военной техники и войнов, тут даже есть ядерные бомбы, но все бы ничего, но  тут есть просто имбалансные юниты, которые сотрут ваши города за один удар, а убивать их просто нечем. Роботы это самые нечестные мобы в игре.

 [h1] Религиозная победа [/h1]

Для «Религиозной победы» нужно «всего лишь» обратить все остальные цивилизации в свою веру. Только веру  необходимо сначала основать, потом как следует укрепить в своей стране, а затем и в чужие цивилизации топать
Помогают в деле такие юниты как «Миссионеры» и «Апостолы». Первые в основном лишь разносят религиозное учение по городам, а вторые могут даже запускать инквизиторское движение. Что-то схожее с военной победой, но сложнее и выиграть против реальных игроков почти нереально, противник может сделать инквизиторов, которые очистят свои города. Так же вам могут объявить войну и все ваши Миссионеры и Апостолы будут просто умирать в страшных муках, очень скучная, нечестная и медленная победа.

 [h1] Культурная победа [/h1]
Самая сложная разновидность победы в игре. Для ее достижения необходимо превратить свою державу в рай для туристов. Большое количество туристов приносит большое количество очков туризма.необходимо очень сильно постараться: иметь множество торговых путей, великих произведений искусства, артефактов, чудес света и других преумножающих культурное влияние свершений; а также у вашего государства должны быть открытые границы и отсутствие действующих военных конфликтов. При нарушении любого из двух последних условий генерация очков туризма приостанавливается.Моя первая победа в игре была именно культурной, всю игру строил чудеса света, не воевал, было много великих людей. Планировал сделать  через науку, но на ходу так 200 плюс  мне говорят что я сделал за культуру, было очень неожиданно и странно. А потом когда я хотел уже реально сделать культурную победу у меня  не получалось, то войну объявят, то всех великих людей скупят, короче сложно и непонятно.

 [h1] Научная победа [/h1]
Для научной победы, во-первых, нужно как можно скорее пробиться через все эры технологического прогресса: от первобытного мира до информационной эпохи. Затем необходимо освоить «Ракетостроение», запустить первый искусственный спутник Земли, высадить человека на Луну и создать колонию на Марсе. Самая скучная и имбалансная победа в игре, ты  впереди планеты всей и войну тебе объявлять не будут, т.к проектах уже есть роботы с ядерками, сидишь себе да, тыкаешь раз в пару ходов проекты изучить.

 [h1] Общая победа [/h1]
Ну, а здесь — все просто. Просто включаете Civilization 6 и наслаждаетесь игрой, ни о чем не задумываясь. Если к 2050 году (стандартный финал) сумма всех видов очков (религии, культуры, науки, туризма и т.д.) у вашей державы окажется больше, чем у всех остальных — вы победили.

73165083.review:
Tentei muito gostar do jogo e cheguei a me divertir em alguns momentos com as expansões, mas Civ VI tem problemas graves, dois deles gravíssimos, na minha opinião. 

(1) O primeiro é a AI, que não consegue ter o mínimo de racionalidade se não tiver as vantagens absurdas dos níveis mais difíceis, a defesa melhorou, mas o ataque da AI é catastrófico, como se as forças adversárias fossem regidas por crianças de 8 anos. Ou seja, para ter desafio eu preciso jogar em nível mais difícil, o que não é divertido, pois o avanço tecnológico dos adversários é mais rápido. Tenho que lutar com um pedaço de pau contra rifles no early game. 

(2) O segundo problema é o fim do jogo. CIV VI poderia ser um ótimo simulador de estratégia de guerra e quando chegamos aos dias atuais, é legal produzir e utilizar armas e unidades atuais. Mas eis que num determinado momento chega  um robozão gigante da morte e outras maravilhas militares futuristas que acabam com o clima do jogo. Sei que muitos gostam disso, mas faz falta um limitador de Eras. Seria interessante poder escolher não apenas em que Era começamos o jogo, mas também até que Era podemos ir. 

Enfim, tinha tudo para ser um jogão, mas a profunda falta de inteligência dos adversários na campanha, a forma como o jogo tenta compensar essa falta de inteligência nos níveis mais difíceis e a irrealidade bélica do fim do jogo conseguem arruinar completamente a experiência.

Found out CIV 6 was sending DNS queries to "metrics.ol.epicgames.com" every 2m for 9hrs yesterday on my multiplayer game. I value my privacy (DNS blocking with a pi-server) and am now assuming, based on the EULA-type reviews, that this Epic Games EOS service (which a lot of people are calling Spyware) replaced the Red Shell ad-tracking service in 2018. However, now it's probably worse. Cannot rename/delete "EOSSDK-Win64-Shipping.dll" (Published by Epic Games, Inc) or else the game crashes on startup. Have blocked their API & metrics domain & will see what happens the next multiplayer.

As far as the game is concerned, it crashes all the time for me on DX12 mode & the June2020 update has only made things worse (check the discussions). The tutorial for "People new to CIV" was the worst I've ever experienced. Game is buggy ESPECIALLY in multiplayer. Had multiple de-syncs & lag issues (we're all 60-70ms) in our Multiplayer party, with 2 of us crashing at different points.

Please fix the graphic issues, poor multiplayer experience, & shady metrics collection to make this game better.

71620277.review:
Игра лучшая в серии, но сразу огорчу тех, кто ждет от игры реализма:
1. В современной эре предлагается огромное число военной техники - самолеты, танки, войска поддержки и даже ядерные бомбы, но все это ничто против РОБОТОВ, которые при некоторой прокачке сносят вашу столицу за 1 удар, разбивают современные танки получая 1 урон (в лучшем случае). Если ваша цивилизация немного отстала по науке, то дойдя до современных танков вы автоматически проигрываете 1 роботу. Когда ты понимаешь что играешь в реалистичную игру, нанимаешь реальных исторических личностей, создаешь реальную технику и проиграть за 5 ходов 1 роботу??? Не подвергнуться ядерному обстрелу, не биться до конца с армадой танков, а просто разбить всю свою огромную армию из 20 танков об робота и нанести ему 5 урона??? Где здесь реалистичность? И главное зачем тогда ядерные бомбы, которые кстати сложнее создавать, чем робота. 
Это главный дисбаланс на мой и не только мой взгляд.
2. Захваченный город можно уничтожить моментально!!! Вот представьте вы строите империю уже часа 3 реального времени и тут сетевой оппонент захватывает у вас город (ну не углядели вы или войска перебросить не успели). Вы быстро перебрасываете войска, чтобы отбить город, а от города уже нет ничего. Его стерли с лица земли. 
Это абсолютно не реалистично для города с населением более 3. Ладно деревню спалить, но город? 
3. Загрязнения окружающей среды очень быстро растапливают ледники при этом неважно какие электростанции вы используете, ведь все равно все будут использовать электростанции в своих городах и выбросы в атмосферу будут огромные, дак зачем мне строить мазутные или солнечные электростанции, если все равно планету затопит?  Если это неизбежно то в чем смысл? Почему нельзя принять дипломатические меры против тех, кто загрезняет воздух сильнее и запретить им строить такие электростанции? Как защитить планету в сетевой игре?

4. Вы хотите победить религией? Идите воевать. У вашей религии нет шанса распространиться против других религий. Противник всегда может сделать инквизиторов и очистить ваши труды захвата за 1 клик. Он может объявить вам войну и сжигать всех проповедников войсками. Скорость влияния вашей религии на оппонентов минимальна. Религия вынуждает вас воевать с иноверцами, а значит это уже не религиозная а военная победа. Здесь явно большая проблема. А еще управление ордой проповедников и апостолов + ведение боевых действий ооочень сильно замедляет игру. Логичнее было бы автоматизировать религиозные войны наподобие торговли.

Итог: Игра прекрасная, если играть в одиночную против компьютеров. При сетевых баталиях игроки действуют реально, а игра дает ужасное послевкусие от всего вышеперечисленного. Просто очень обидно когда веришь в реальность игры, а тебя за 2 хода уничтожает какой-нибудь робот или твой современный танк с атакой 90 разбивается вдребезги при атаке форта с защитой 78, нанеся ему 1 урон. Мне кажется или что-то здесь не так?

72209578.review:
I have played Civilization games for over 10 years, but after two expansions and 329 hours on Civilization VI, I've found that I can't recommend it to new or familiar players of Civilization.

The primary reason for this has to do with the diplomacy functions. They have become nonsensical and frustrating to deal with. I don't play this game to be frustrated. I play to be challenged and to express creativity, but the absurd AI actions around diplomacy have come to make this very difficult. Examples of this include:
1. Surprise wars with no diplomatic repercussions, either once or repeatedly by the same characters.
2. Nonsensical peace options, such as taking a city from a player that has declared a surprise war on you and then becoming the target of an emergency. How does this make sense?
3. Random denunciations with very little contact with the character. This one really breaks reason.
4. Denunciations or demands from characters centuries after the last peace deal. Complaints that a former city of theirs is "occupied" when it was the transfer was agreed upon in a peace deal.
5. Very little relationship building. Character relationships often feel predestined from the start.
6. Overall, character relationships feel childish and stagnant. This is certainly not representative of any real diplomacy. And, while I understand this is a game, is it not trying to replicate parts of reality?

I'm sure there are others that I'm currently not able to think of.

Now, none of this is to say that the history of war and diplomacy has been full of reason and rationality. However, one is typically able to see quite simply the connections between 1) one's desire for war and 2) the declaration of war itself. In other words, one's desire and the action to seize this desire. This is not the case in Civilization VI.

I recommend reading Machiavelli's The Prince and overhauling the AI accordingly. Until then, I'll be sticking to Europa Universalis IV.

71780787.review:
Начал осваивать игру, когда получил ее бесплатно в Эпик, до этого в игры данной серии никогда не играл. 

Это было нелегко, на то чтобы более менее понять как все устроено ушло не менее 20 часов игры и 5 часов различных гайдов на ютюбе по разным аспектам игры. И оно того стоило - сейчас получаю массу положительных эмоций от игры и от продолжающегося обучения. Взял в Стиме Платиновое издание с дополнениями Rise and Fall и Gathering Storm, без них голая игра совсем пресная и урезанная по механикам. Покупать дополнительный контент Frontier Pass до того как Вы наиграете несколько сот часов смысла нет (наций и сюжетнвх режимов и так очень много), я купил просто из уважения к игре и поддержки разработчиков.

После 50 часов все еще возникают вопросы по разным аспектам. Для начинающих я бы советовал обязательно смотреть гайды, это значительно ускорит процесс входа. Сначала поиграйте часов 5 с обучением, потом можно начинать играть и параллельно смотреть гайды. По приоритету я бы расставил гайды в следующем порядке (но смотреть все сразу бесполезно, усвоить сразу нереально, если бы был предмет по Civilization 6 в университете, то его точно можно было изучать в течение 10-15 пар):

1) Интерфейс (где что смотреть, как взаимодействовать с игрой). В начале будет казаться, что Вы оказались в программе по торговле ценными бумагами и валютой: будет вообще ничего непонятно, со временем все уляжется в голове и придет пониманию, что ничего лишнего в интерфейсе нет)
2) Виды побед и методы их достижения
3) Как правильно ставить города
4) Как правильно ставить районы в городах
5) Виды ресурсов (бонусные, редкие, стратегические)
6) Наука, Культура, Чудеса света (основные ресурсы, двигающие Вашу Цивилизацию вперед по развитию)
7) Довольство
8) Лояльность + Губернаторы (две отдельные, но связанные темы)
9) Торговля
10) Война (для военной победы, обороны и/или захвата новых земель)
11) Эпохи (темный век - обычный - золотой век)
12) Электричество

Это можно отложить и изучить в последнюю очередь после первых 12 разделов
13) Вера: пантеоны, религии, религиозные юниты (для бонусов от веры и при желании получении религиозной победы)
14) Туризм (для культурной победы)
15) Дипломатия (для дипломатической победы и получения разных бонусов по мере развития)

Конечно, помимо вышеуказанных разделов есть еще и масса маленьких тем. Надеюсь мои рекомендации будут полезны и Вы не забросите игру, а разберетесь и начнете получать от нее удовольствие.

El sistema de juego es más ordenado, está más claro, y sobretodo no tienes que esperar a tu p.to compañero durante 30min a que decida hacer su turno gracias a los turnos simultáneos... La IA sigue denunciandote y tratandote como si fueras bobo mientras marilizas sus ciudades con robots llenos de uranio con bombas atómicas en los bolsillos. Nada puede salir mal.

La idea de que te van contando cosas de la historia, obras de arte, facciones, y en si pequeños detalles que se ven hasta en los logros que lo hace más gracioso. La expansión de los desastres naturales esta muy bien, eso de que de repente se te queme media ciudad, aparezca una tormenta y te arrase unos meteoritos siempre esta bien ;P (2020 aprueba este comentario)

En resumen, un juego genial para darle un vicio corto de unas 80h mínimo, si te gustan los juegos de estrategia, algo así como los Colonos de Catan pero viendo en 3D las figuritas.

71581518.review:
Ich habe über 1.200 Std in CIV4(+ca 1.000 std aus der PräSteam Zeit) und über 800 Std in CIV5 bin also eigentlich mehr als ein Fan. Aber CIV 6 ist schon mehr als nur ein Reinfall. 

Klar ist man es heute gewohnt das ein Spiel unfertig auf den Markt kommt und das ein oder andere nicht so funktioniert, wie man es erwarten würde, aber CIV 6 ist selbst jetzt mit 2 großen ADD Ons noch vollkommen unpolished. 

Ich hatte eigentlich nicht vor das Spiel nach ausprobieren das Standardspiels noch einmal anzufassen, habe mich durch den Summersale doch noch dazu hinreißen lassen, die beiden ADD Ons zu erwerben.

Das Spiel gibt mir das Gefühl, dass die Entwickler die Vorgänger nie gespielt haben. In den meisten Fällen greifen bei diesen die einzelnen Systeme bestens ineinander und als Spieler erfährt man keine "künstlichen Hindernisse". 
- In CIV 6 beispielsweise kann man sich gegnerische Bewegungen nicht anzeigen lassen. Statt dessen muss man im Krieg jedes mal seine Grenzen absuchen, 
- Man muss seine Einheiten jede Runde NEU verschanzen, wenn eine feindliche Einheit in der Nähe ist (Wozu gibts denn die Möglichkeit die Einheit in den "Überwachungsmodus" zu versetzen, Wenn verschanzen genau dasselbe macht?
- Man kann nicht automatisch erkunden, wenn ein Feind in der Nähe ist und noch schlimmer: Man kann nicht automatisch erkunden wenn eine Ruine in der Nähe ist?????? echt jetzt?

Solche Fehler, die den Spielflow unterbrechen sind an der Tagesordnung. Eigentlich spielt man in jeder einzelnen Runde eine Art Subspiel, sowas wie einen rundenbasierten Cookieklicker ohne Belohnungen -.-

Die KI war in allen CIVs schon immer unter der Gürtellinie, aber zumindest in 4 war sie noch fordernd. In 6 scheint sie nur noch dazu da zu sein um dem Spieler mit bescheuerten und vollkommen schwachsinnigen Kommentaren auf den Senkel zu gehen. 
Desweiteren kann es vorkommen, dass die KI einem in der einen Runde in den Arsch kriecht und in der nächsten dann den Krieg erklärt. Dann kann man nur noch müde Grinsen und abwarten bis die KI sich auf den Weg über den ganzen Kontinent macht um einen mit 2 oder 3 vollkommen unzureichenden Einheit "angreift".

Letzte Kritik(auf die ich grad noch Lust hab), die leider auch bei Teil 5 schon zutrifft, vllt sogar noch eher:
Man sollte eigentlich Herrscher über ein ganzes Land bzw einen Staat sein, eine Nation, die nach und nach zusammenwächst und immer größer wird. Stattdessen herrscht man über eine handvoll loser Städte die wild in der Gegend verstreut sind. Die Übersichtskarte sieht später im Spiel meist eher aus wie ein buntes Bällebad im Kinderspieleparadies.

Schade um diese schöne Spieleserie

72276659.review:
It might be the fact that my craving for advanced strategy has grown significantly since I first played Civ V all those years ago, and how I'll have little issue sinking dozens of hours into a Total War campaign, or the fact that I've been playing Paradox strategy games non-stop for the past 8 years, but something about Civ 6 feels tactically... vapid.

I sunk well over 100 hours in to Civ IV when I bought a collection disc at a big box store in like 2009. It was so much fun learning, exploring, growing an empire, etc. I had no issue again sinking 100+ hours in to Civ V. I loved creating custom scenarios and playing them out, I loved getting huge maps on the work shop and playing far-too-massive games on them. I thought the whole international council and diplomacy mechanic was handled in a pretty refreshing way- I usually mod out/avoid late games in the Civ series, capping technology at the medieval or renaissance era, but Civ V actually convinced me to play into the eras I dreaded from Civ IV a few times, and it was actually pretty fun.

Going from the stunning steps forward in Civ V, and noting where systems were lacking, it should have been very easy to make Civ 6 and excellent game, and well, it's very far from that. I've only put in about 12 and a half hours, and tbh about two hours of that was the game running in the background while I did something else. I don't feel the desire to play more, because even if I put the game on a higher difficulty, the challenge won't feel rewarding, because the actual strategic skeleton of the game is so hollow.

I mentioned the game seeming vapid earlier, and to expand on that idea I feel like I need to articulate that Civ 6 feels like it has a lot to say, but if you listen it's truthfully saying very little. All of the systems implemented in the game are surface deep. There's no sense of anything growing to be more complex than minor bonuses to your civilization. Religion, like in Civ V, is still a joke- and I'm pretty sure many of the modifiers from it have just been copy/pasted from Civ V to here. 

This game's AI diplomacy makes Total War's diplomacy look like the UN. Everything is still surface deep, the AI is still extremely erratic and often nonsensical. The civilization series has always prided itself on its diplomatic and peaceful approach options, yet to me these have always been headache inducing considering just how poor the AI is on both a tactical and strategic level. This game is by far no exception.

Civ V made late game diplomacy interesting, at the very least, in a system where you vie for international votes in the late game world council, in this game, hoooooooo boy, be prepared to be let down.

The world council first convenes when you enter the medieval era. Let that sink in- the UN is established before the chivalric code. Resolutions are passed amongst nations that have never met. You seldom ever get to decide what resolutions there are, either. You're told to vote on for two options for two resolutions, and pick a target for that resolutions. Are you trying to get a diplomatic victory, by the way? You get points for this by picking the resolution that passes in the medieval world congress, which is easy enough because the game often hints at what resolution will pass. BUT you also need to pick the correct target of the resolution, be it a civilization that gets bonuses or hindrance, or one of 30 luxury resources that gets banned. Good luck, fucker. This can be made easier by having a crap ton of diplomatic points to just sway the world in your favor, but the cost for each vote is exponential, so even this has limited effect.

So, to cap off the last section, the UN begins by having every medieval civilization meet up and decide to arbitrarily ban cinnamon, almost unanimously. I get these games aren't meant to be that historic, but having a system this stupid in a game that at least pretends to care about history is just really, really strange.

It just feels like every aspect of this game leaves so much to be desired. Above all this game just feels like it lacks tactical challenge and those moments of clarity and learning that make strategy games feel amazing to play.  Nothing about Civ 6 is malignantly bad, but nothing justifies its still high price tag and all of its very overpriced DLC.

TL;DR, go buy Civilization V if they ever put it on sale again. It's a much better time sink than this.

I will say, though, this game has some fresh-ass main menu music.

71751323.review:
[h1] Análise Sid Meier's Civilization® VI [/h1]

 Sendo direto, mesmo após três anos Civilization VI segue como o capítulo menos interessante da franquia.A introdução dos distritos e o sistema de governança foram adições focadas em tornar o gênero 4X menos monolítico, mas pagou seu preço por ser ambiciosa demais.Além disso, a mecânica original privilegiava enormemente nações belicosas, favorecendo a vitória militar sobre todas as outras.
 Rise and Fall foi uma expansão confusa, que mexeu em quase tudo com a inclusão das Eras e de um sistema de lealdade, mas que não mudou nada relevante.Por sua vez, Gathering Storm se focou no básico, fez ajustes e implementou uma mecânica de eventos climáticos, que podem destruir estratégias ou serem usados a seu favor.
 O grande problema é que para se tornar um título verdadeiramente interessante, Civilization VI depende de Gathering Storm, e como se não bastasse, a expansão custa ainda mais caro nos consoles, pois vem em um pack acorrentada a Rise and Fall.Esses problemas fizeram com que outros títulos, como Endless Space 2, Distant Worlds Universe, Endless Legend, Star Ruler 2 e até mesmo lançamentos recentes da série Total War (que possui um sistema de lealdade mais inteligente) dispersassem os fãs da franquia.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/947510/Sid_Meiers_Civilization_VI_Gathering_Storm/

 Claro, Civ VI agora oferece a vantagem de que você pode joga-lo como e quando quiser: no computador, com teclado e mouse, longe de casa em seu iPhone ou Switch, ou esparramado no sofá da sala, no PS4 ou Xbox One.
 A meu ver, o melhor 4X da Firaxis segue sendo Sid Meier's Civilization V: Brave New World, mas é bom ver que a desenvolvedora e a 2K Games estão minimamente empenhadas em consertar burradas passadas; Red Death é um indicativo de que ao menos estão tentando.
 
[b] Pontos Fortes [/b]

[list]
    [*]Versões para consoles são ports perfeitos (para o bem e para o mal);
    [*]Redefiniu conceitos do 4X, ainda que de modo desajeitado.
[/list]


[b] Pontos Fracos [/b]

[list]
    [*]Jogo base é mais punitivo para certas nações e tipos de vitória;
    [*]Depende da expansão Gathering Storm para se tornar realmente interessante.
[/list]

[b] Ficha Técnica [/b]

[list]
    [*]Plataformas — Windows, macOS, Linux, PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, iOS;
    [*]Desenvolvedora — Firaxis Games;
    [*]Distribuidora — 2K Games;
    [*]Preço (não promocional) — R$ 129 (Windows/macOS/Linux); R$ 249,90 (PS4), R$ 249,95 (Xbox One), R$ 249 (Switch), gratuito (trial de 60 turnos) com compras no app (iOS);
    [*]Classificação Indicativa — 10 anos.
[/list]

[u]Fonte base:[/u] Techtudo (só pesquisar, a steam bloqueia links).

72330234.review: Civ 5 was and still is one of my favourite games on steam; it's a game that is simple enough to allow you to understand what you are doing from the get go yet at the same time intricate enough to give you unique enjoyment after hundreds of hours and I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone regardless of your gaming background due to it being one of the most accessible strategy games out there. The mechanics and game-play create a game environment that is quintessential of the phrase 'one more turn'. That's why I was incredibly hyped for the release of the next game in my new favourite series and pre-ordered civ 6 for a price of 50 quid. I jumped straight into the game the day it launched and was promisingly greeted by another stunning score by Christopher Tin and a narration by Sean Bean. However, my excitement quickly subsided several turns into the game and I was struck by a realisation, about 5 hours in, that this game was not fun. The graphics, although being arguably much more advanced than those of civ 5, felt childish and took away from any seriousness that the game may have had. The reworks to wonders, the culture system, buildings and citizens seemed to have taken place solely for the point of changing the game to be different from civ 5 and only worked to give the player an immense headache. Somehow, even though the game was developed a whole generation after its predecessor the AI was even worse than it had been in civ 5 and proceeded to make life a living hell for any player not going for a world conquest due to seemingly random AI declarations. Finally, the civ series has always had 2 alternative philosophies of expansion:playing tall and focusing on a few cities, or playing wide and conquering as much as possible; in previous games both these schools of thought were viable and the ability of each civilization to play either or gave more flavour to the games. But in this game the new housing and building mechanics have made playing tall completely inviable and further limits this game can be played. After forcing myself to slog through a whole play-through, futilely convincing myself the game must get better, I concluded that I hated the game and resolved to never open it again. My friends tell me that the new updates and dlc have made the game 'good now' yet I still refuse to play it for two reasons: one, you should never have to buy dlc to make an already 50 pound game playable; and two, the memory of the pain of my first play-through still haunts me and I can't bring myself to put myself through that torture again. Civ 5 is still a brilliant game today and so I will continue to play that and ignore the existence of civ 6 and advise others to do the same.

73995847.review:
Before I say my opnoin, I am no Civ Expert having only played Civ 2 Revolution on IOS before purchasing this for my Mac 

That being said I am very impressed. 

It's in-depth beyond what I could comprehend out of the older one.  It is very challenging but also rewarding when you pull off the right moves to move your civ ahead of the others. 

Personally, it's also quite relaxing to play and does not anger me as much as other games do. When I screw up mostly I blame myself instead of the mechanics, but the drive to make a comeback is still there

That sounds like a load of bull I know, but trust me this game is really damm awesome. Way to go Sid Meir keep it up! 

9/10 

point deducted for tutorial not really being up to par in my opnoin

73994747.review: Tengo un gran problema, sigo comprando este juego sabiendo que no es lo mismo que fue en sus inicios... un juego innovador. Ahora practicamente repiten la misma formula, le ponen graficos para neonatos y ya está. Los desarrolladores al parecer nunca entendieron a los jugadores que le dieron la fama que ostentan. Nunca evolucionaron sus personajes, ni lograron hacer de civilization un juego que en realidad desarrollara una civilización. Cuando pequeño no me molestaba ver por un lado a Lincoln contra Hammurabi, ahora lo aborrezco. Deberían asociarse con pixar y estrenar una pelicula para niños, porque eso es lo que ofrece este juego, un episodio de los teletubbis es mas inmersivo. CIV nunca más. escribo esta reseña para recordarlo y no regalarles mas mi dinero.

73990827.review:
[h1]tl;dr[/h1]
Get it if you enjoyed the previous Civ games; newcomers beware of the effort you need to put in to get better
[h1]Thoughts[/h1]
Personally, I did not enjoy this game at all, but I know that this game is very well made and would be fun if you have enjoyed the previous Civ games. There is also a very high skill cap that is comparable to Chess. However, the skill curve is way too high for newcomers like me. Hopping into an online game after learning the basics is a nightmare; I found myself falling behind slowly but surely every game I've played so far and I don't understand why. Even when I look at basic tutorials, I still don't understand how to improve my gameplay. Sure I could spend 100s of hours learning the fundamentals, but it's so monotonous. There's another issue of every game getting cut short due to somebody leaving midway or other friends get on and want to join.
[h1]Scores[/h1]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Category[/th]
        [th]Score[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td]8/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Animations[/td]
        [td]7/10[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]9/10*[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Difficulty Curve[/td]
        [td]Aggressive[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Replayability[/td]
        [td]Infinite[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr][td][/td][td][i]*6/10 if playing online[/i][/td][/tr]
[/table] 
[h1]Verdict[/h1]
A very solid game if you have friends and still fun with randoms. Learning curve is very high which was a turn off for me, but those that are returning from previous Civ installments should enjoy this game.

十分好玩且杀时间的游戏 只要你认真玩进去就发现游戏的魅力是极大的

73977508.review:
非常精細的戰略遊戲，足以讓人沉默，不知不覺間便玩了半天。
很好地體現了各文明的特點、時代的變遷，外交間的風雲色變，往往要暗藏一手。面對戰爭版圖，玩家總要想武力征服全球，卻知道其難處。
當發展到一定程度，對特定資有必要性需求，便促使您行使戰爭進行掠奪。
新資料片中更加入了氣候變化，讓玩家在戰略發展的同時，亦要思索過度發帶來的影響。

如遊戲後期能夠加入（補回）民工自動開發功能就好了，不論是修路或修復因天災影響的地方…這功能本來在文明5是有的…
